} } } Length:: 1:08 MinsI think the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 is the best of the underwater POS cameras. When writing "How To Take Stunning Underwater Photos Using Point And Shoot Cameras" (Kindle, Nook, Lulu and Apple) we tested and tried every POS underwater camera we could find and the Tough 8010 was the clear winner for price, quality, and ruggedness. I am about to buy another. This will be my forth in three years. Not bad when you consider we are in the water most every day and the cameras get tossed around without much care. (I work as a yacht captain) The cameras are all still working, but get a little tired after about a year of abuse.The only drawback seems to be the LONG reset time between photos. Still check out the video we are posting. Pretty good stuff for a POS pocket camera.One more thought is we have had dozens of underwater photos published taken with the Olympus Tough. That is pretty good when you consider most published photos were taken with expensive, SLR underwater cameras.Hope that helps other choose.

Reviews.Title: Watch this camera in salt water
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased the lesser of the Olympus Stylus Tough and had to return it because of "water damage". I am a professional photographer and I made absolutely sure the camera was locked for water use each time but it still had water damage. The second one I purchased was the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 and it worked great until I used is several times in the ocean. Again I made sure it was locked- even re-locked it- but still it retained water damage once again. I can't imagine I had two bad cameras though it is possible... However, with my experience, the chances it was user-induced are reasonably unlikely.As for ease of use and general digital camera functioning, it was fine. I will stick to Canon cameras after this.

Reviews.Title: CHILDPROOF INDESTRUCTIBLE GREAT HD VIDEO
Reviews.Author: Ted Moyer "Ted"
Reviews.Content: PROS:* WATERPROOF, SHOCKPROOF, FREEZEPROOF, KID PROOF* GOOD QUALITY 720P VIDEO -  LINK TO WATCH SAMPLE VIDEO (...)* ANOTHER VIDEO - (...)* EXCELLENT PICS @14 MEGAPIXELS* GREAT LOW LIGHT PICS* GREAT LOW LIGHT VIDEO* ACCELEROMETER FOR GLOVES/SNOW/WATER ETCCONS:* SLOW WRITE TO SD MEDIA EVEN SDHC CLASS 6 COMPARED TO PREVIOUS OLYMPUS 1035SW SUPER FAST WRITE WITH XD MEDIA* MENU IS A CROSS BAR LIKE PS3 THAT REQUIRES MULTIPLE PUSHES VERSUS FAST ACCESS TO FEATURES* NO SHUTTER SPEED CONTROLSUMMARY:BEST DESTRUCTION PROOF CAMERA YOU CAN BUT THAT WILL GO ANYWHERE AND DO ANYTHING AND STILL KEEP TAKING PICTURES AND VIDEO

Reviews.Title: Olympus 8010
Reviews.Author: Florence Dickie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Ecuador after purchasing two others that I returned, the Vivitar and the Pentax. This one was definitely much better. The pictures were clear, it worked beautifully underwater. I took it down to only about 10 feet though. I would have liked a bigger zoom, but this one beat out all the competition for an underwater camera. It's small size was great to put in my pocket. I ended up using it on most days rather than my larger Olympus C740. It takes great close-ups with the macro lens too. I am extremely pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS camera!  Great price!
Reviews.Author: James D. Leone "jdleone"
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time investigating underwater digital cameras.  Each and EVERY camera had roughly 10% to 20% of negative reviews.  I visited different stores to hold the cameras in my hands and to see how sturdy they each felt.After 4 weeks of intense review, I decided upon this camera for the following reasons:1) 5X optical zoom2) Cool color blue3) Sturdy and solid as a rock4) Price is highly competitive5) One touch video recording6) The buttons are very EZ to use...even under waterWe took this camera to Punta Cana in the Caribbean.  I used it in the kids water park, in the large adult pools, in the ocean, on a deserted island, while snorkeling, and while scuba diving.  This camera met each and every challenge with no problems whatsoever!  I even banged it against the side of the pool two or three times by accident and it just keeps on working.  It's EXCELLENT.  It's rated for a depth of 16.5 feet, but I took it 20 feet under during a 40 minute dive and had zero problems!  I never had to use the manual because the camera has a help button that provides more details for every menu option.The camera is easy to use for still photos and video.  In terms of battery usage, it does very well when shooting still photos with the flash on.  For some reason it seems to consume the battery pretty quickly when shooting video....but that doesn't matter because you can pick up an extra battery for very little money on Amazon.  The video files are saved in the MP4 file format....which is GREAT because it takes up less space than AVI files !!!  Check out the pictures I uploaded!I had zero problems with the camera focusing.  It's awesome!UPDATE: November 2011 (2 months since my original review).  I purchased the camera in August and took it on vacation (as mentioned above).  The camera was awesome on the trip and still works just fine.  I have zero regrets and will continue to take this camera on vacations/trips etc.  After using it for 3 months, I think it's AWESOME for underwater stills and video.  I most recently took this camera to the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon - it was such a great feeling to use it for video rather than bringing along a separate camcorder!  My only "concern" is that when I shoot pics of my kids at school (indoors), the photos come out just "average".  I'm not sure if it's me, or the flash isn't strong enough, or maybe I need to read the manual, but some photos come out a little dark, and sometimes a bit blurry.  Having said all this, the camera is still AWESOME for the pool, snorkeling, SCUBA diving, and anything where the conditions are wet!

Reviews.Title: Toughest camera you can buy!
Reviews.Author: Craig Napolitano
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera. From everything people had written, it was hands down the most durable and waterproof. So far all of this holds true. I have had it a week and taken it jet skiing, in the ocean, and for an extended period of time underwater in a pool. The underwater pics and 720p video are great. Love the quick video record button. People complain about the quality of the pics, but I have already gotten many compliements on how it must be a professional camera. The only 2 downsides are it does take about 3-4 seconds to turn on, and can only take a pic about every 1-2 seconds, so it is not for shooting sports, but it is perfect for vactions as well as anything else since it looks like a normal camera unlike the others (i.e. canon)

Reviews.Title: Not the Camera of Choice
Reviews.Author: HB Mom "Wendy"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we own and use many camera of all sizes and types.  Everything from small point and shoots to high end SLR cameras.  We bought this for a trip to Catalina with the thought that it would be good for underwater and general use near the water and at the beach.  It is sturdy and well sealed, but the underwater pictures terrible.  We have used sealed housings for small point and shoot cameras underwater in the past and the pictures were significantly better.  I chose this because I thought it would be easier for my son underwater, not having to mess with putting the camera in a housing.  He has used the camera in the housing before underwater and taken great pictures.  The regular "dry land" pictures were okay, but nothing special.  Less expensive and small Canons and Nikons do a better job with better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Any less than 4 Stars is a lie!
Reviews.Author: flipnotrab "flipnotrab"
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks! It takes fantastic pictures PLENTY fast enough for ANY average user.  I'll bet you can't find another camera that you can take underwater and take GREAT MACRO pictures with for under $1700.00.  The low raters in here have SLR on the brain or something.  We have rattled off thousands of pictures of our new son and they are ALL great.  I'm also in the swimming pool industry and get paid 2 or 3 times week to do underwater photography for inspections. This camera will zoom in on the tip of screw or a chip in the plaster with perfect clarity, then pop a button and zoom out wide to get a whole shot of the entire deep end of the pool.  It is VERY easy to use in every way too.  Switching settings by bumping the top, bottom or sides is a GREAT feature if you have gloves on too.  Again, this camera rocks! You want a sports action frame by frame camera? Go buy a SLR or something.  You want a great family camera that will take the abuse of kids and a tropical or ski vacation? You found it right here! And no, I don't work for Olympus but I am underwater a whole bunch.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for SCUBA
Reviews.Author: chief
Reviews.Content: Camera works great, I actually took pictures below 33ft (approximately 60ft) with no problems, when I got deeper than 60 ft the buttons stopped working but the camera started working again when above 33ft.  Great pictures and videos, not sure how to get out of video mode once I get in it (other than powering it down), but I guess I'm going to have to read the manual for that, the rest is pretty intuitive though.

Reviews.Title: INDESTRUCTIBLE AND CHILD PROOF GOOD HD VIDEO
Reviews.Author: Ted Moyer "Ted"
Reviews.Content: PROS:* WATERPROOF, SHOCKPROOF, FREEZEPROOF, KID PROOF* GOOD QUALITY 720P VIDEO -  LINK TO WATCH SAMPLE VIDEO [...]* ANOTHER VIDEO - [...]* EXCELLENT PICS @14 MEGAPIXELS* GREAT LOW LIGHT PICS* GREAT LOW LIGHT VIDEO* ACCELEROMETER FOR GLOVES/SNOW/WATER ETCCONS:* MODERATE WRITE TO SD MEDIA EVEN SDHC CLASS 6 COMPARED TO PREVIOUS OLYMPUS 1035SW SUPER FAST WRITE WITH XD MEDIA* MENU IS A CROSS BAR LIKE PS3 THAT REQUIRES MULTIPLE PUSHES VERSUS FAST ACCESS TO FEATURES* NO SHUTTER SPEED CONTROLSUMMARY:BEST DESTRUCTION PROOF CAMERA YOU CAN BUT THAT WILL GO ANYWHERE AND DO ANYTHING AND STILL KEEP TAKING PICTURES AND VIDEO

Reviews.Title: It better be tough, you will be throwing it in frustration.
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I have owned lots of digital cameras in my life, from point and shoot to SLR, and even previous Olympus Stylus tough model 850SW.I really liked the Olympus 850 SW, it was small, took decent pictures, and was tough / waterproof, but the battery life was very short. I "upgraded" to the olympus 8010 because of the HD video. I took the new camera on a trip to Costa Rica and I have HATED it ever since. I have really tried to like this camera but I can't. Here is why:1. It takes wayyyy too long to turn on. I missed so many shots waiting for it to load.2. Menu system is painfully slow and inconvenient.3. 90% of pictures are either washed out, or dark silhouettes.4. Video is washed out, very desaturated, and choppy.5. The slightest movement, touch, or zooming causes a very loud rustling noise on your videos.6. The camera is a brick. Very big and bulky compared to the previous 850sw model.In my opinion, olympus ruined the tough series camera, slapped larger meaningless specs on the box, and bumped up the price tag. If you are looking for a waterproof video camera, go with a GoPro Hero. If you want a point and shoot that you can get wet. go with a previous model from the tough series such as an 850sw if you can find them online.

Reviews.Title: It's as tough as Olympus says it is.
Reviews.Author: robin
Reviews.Content: Our 15-year-old son received it for a 3-week trip to Central America.  He snorkeled in salt water, hiked, tubed, swam, and climbed with the 8010.  He lost it twice, once on a river bank after it fell out of his pocket, once in the mud on a another river after he dropped it.  He found it, and then used a carabiner to attach it to his shorts. It was in salt, sand, wind, water, mud, and was dropped.  It takes beautiful photos, and excellent underwater video.  It went where our camera could not go, by far.  The telephoto and macro were used for wildlife and insect close-ups. Night time video and sound quality were good.  The camera body only suffered a couple of scratches, after use which could have been used in a commercial advertising the product. It had sufficient memory for photo and video with a 16 GB HDSC card.We are wildlife biologists, and we had a photographer/ecotour guide with us, and we all would like to purchase this camera for ourselves.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality, poor customer service, prone to break
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: I drag my stuff through rough conditions, and this camera seems to stand up to the challenge, while also taking excellent pictures.First off, this camera replaces an SW720, which I had for 3 or 4 years. My son took that one to Vietnam with him, so I got this one to replace it. The 720 had always taken really good pictures for me, and I'd drug it through rainstorms, sub-zero backcountry ski trips, and hauled it in my sweat-soaked cycling jersey across Kansas and Colorado in July, all with no ill effects to the camera. This experience led me to want to get the next generation. Some of the reviews I read made me a little cautious, as there seemed to be some folks with picture quality issues.My experience to date is that this camera is easier to use than the 720, (and I considered the 720 easy to use), and the picture quality is every bit as good as the 720. I'm not a professional, and I'm sure that this sort of camera doesn't take images that can compare to a high-end SLR. However, it seems to me that once you step into the point and shoot world, this camera is as good as any in terms of the images it captures. Like any of these cameras, the "magic and presets" that they build in make it very easy to take bad pictures if you aren't careful. For example, if you tell the camera you're taking indoor pictures with flo lights, then try taking outdoor pictures in the sun, you're not going to like the images. However, if you learn how to keep the auto settings at the right place, the pictures seem to be excellent.Regarding ease of use, I really like the layout of the menu, and have come to the point where I can easily make changes to the settings I normally mess with. I do think that the manufactures of these devices should spend more time with people to learn the way people really use cameras, and set up the flow of menus in a way that's better suited to most users. That said, this camera is better than many I've played with, but then again, maybe they're all improving.The one thing I don't like is the weight - this feels about 50% heavier than the 720. If you're designing a device for rugged use, a good assumption is that weight is an important factor to that user. Figure our a way to reduce weight.Have taken a couple thousand images so far - will update again after using it for a year.UPDATE: I've used the camera for over a year now. I retract what I earlier said about image quality - it's not as good as the 720, and certainly not as good as many other cameras I've used. Both the sharpness of the image and the color "mixing" leave something to be desired. I've messed with forcing a lower ISO and everything else I can think of, but have concluded that the quality of the "picture-taking" ability is simply not there.On top of that, after only 4 months, the camera gave me fits on a long cycling trip. I bought a cheap replacement until I could get home and get this one repaired. The cheap replacement took better images. After getting it home, I had to ship the camera to Olympus for repairs, which took many weeks, and now the camera has begun acting up again. While I initially gave this 4 stars, I have to say that after using it for a year, I'm dropping that rating to 2 stars. It would be one star, but it is still rugged - just takes poor images and seems prone to break.

Reviews.Title: Bit disappointed
Reviews.Author: Gadgety Refudiate
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time Olympus fan and owner of a Olympus DSLR. The great thing about Olympus cameras is that the pictures need little or no editing. I have seen pictures taken by older Olympus Tough series cameras and hence decided to buy the latest model. What I liked about this camera: It is tough, bit heavy, but really tough. You can give to the kids and not worry about them breaking it. What I didn't like:1.Picture quality. The camera says 14.1MP. The file size may be big, but the quality is lost.2. Extremely slow. Even with the smallest file setting, time between two clicks is few seconds.3. Hard to operate. I had a hard time navigating between the controls.I had bought this to use as an everyday camera and also for scuba diving. I had ordered Ikelite casing for this camera. I'm cancelling that as I returned this to amazon.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera...
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Stylus Tough all weather camera.  I absolutely LOVE this camera, just took it with me to Egypt and Greece and came back with the most amazing pictures.  Best of all, I was able to take it in the pools and ocean and had great pictures.  Takes a little getting used to using all the features and the panoramic function actually works best with manual setting.  I played around with it and found the best and easiest way to use it.  It can be a bit slow taking the photo when the flash is on, so I turned off when I didn't need and didn't have a problem.  I also bought a high speed SD card to use with it and that helped speed it up also.Overall, it's a GREAT ME-proof camera cause I certainly don't baby my camera.

Reviews.Title: it wasnt all that
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for our 4th of july 2010 beach trip. It took great quality pictures while we were there. the camera itself was extremely slow it took 30 seconds to a minute for it to turn on completely to take a picture. Changing the settings took forever too. The charger connection was extremely loose and had to push it in on a flat surface so the cable would not fall out. The flash is in a horrible spot so when you try to take a picture your finger covers the flash and it takes half of the picture away as if you are covering the lens. the side lock doesnt work very well outside of water and the battery cover will fly open at random.when we got back from the beach i took it to a pool party to show off and it stopped working. it would turn on with "Olympus" on the screen and then shut off, leaving the lens cover open. after the camera shut itself off the shutter would make grinding noises as if it was trying to focus on something but couldnt.i was really disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Turtle Time
Reviews.Content: OK, let me start by emphasizing this is a POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA. I never understand people who want to take a fully zoomed image at 14 Mega Pixels on a point and shoot and aren't satisfied with image quality, this is NOT a DSLR. Also, if you know what you are doing and correctly adjust your settings, this camera takes amazing photos. I bought this one because I am a mom and I need my everyday camera to be up to a little more abuse. Plus being able to take pictures at the beach and in cold (such as in the snow) opens up a new world of photography. I saw reviews before I purchased the camera saying the shutter speed or time between photos was too slow and that is just not the case. When you buy these new, they come with the firmware upgrade available at Olympus for FREE that makes the time between shots faster. The shutter speed is fine, unless you are trying to take pictures of Hummingbirds on cocaine or something. The 'burst shot' or 'progressive shot' option is great for parents. There ARE SLIGHTLY better tough cams on the market right now, but the price difference is STAGGERING for a few more megapixels (and lets be honest again, this is an everyday use point and shoot... NOT a DSLR. I DOUBT you are using this for professional photography). You HAVE to read the directions to maintain waterproofing, very important or you can damage your components. Also, I have read things about mediocre battery life on here and it not coming with a wall charger. You can buy the battery hub charger from Olympus, NEVER use generic (they pose the risk of exploding). The best way to maintain battery life is to NEVER take out your battery with bare hands! The oils from your hands can make your battery overheat and expand and over time you lose battery life. The only thing I can say to get the best shots is to NOT rely on you camera to take the best photos in Auto. You need to play around with it for a few hours and see what kind of settings get you what type of results. I use the "pet" setting with burst shot on my son, and it takes better photos then the portrait setting because he moves so much. Overall it is easy to use (for me) Just buy it, honestly it's only $150

Reviews.Title: Has many good qualities
Reviews.Author: V. jung
Reviews.Content: I had an older Olympus that I loved but it broke (because my daughter had it in the rain) and Olympus does not fix it anymore but offered a trade-in deal.  I chose this because it is supposed to be waterproof and drop-proof.  I have used it on four or five occasions so far. But I have not deeply tested it.Pros:My kids and their friends put it in a soda glass to test it and it came out unscathed.  It hooks up seamlessly to the TV so we can immediately watch the movies and photos on TV- It has RCA and USB.  The panorama setting is cool and looks great.  The HD video looks good.  Nice internal memory. Settings are fairly easy to use.  Size and weight are good.  Zoom works well. Buttons are straight forward. Video recording is easy.Cons:I find it has a long lag time between pics in the regular setting.  The video sound quality is pretty bad.  It has some hum sometimes- and does not capture spoken sounds well.  Ambient is OK. I had a sandisc memory card in the camera and when it filled up, the camera did not automatically go to its internal memory.  I had to take out the card when it was full.  I may not be finding the right settings for that.  The indoor light balance of the video was a little yellow on one occasion.Overall I think this is great for vacations and general use.  I am counting on it as the camera for my teens.  If I was looking for really beautiful photos I would purchase a second camera for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: Very Slow
Reviews.Author: jimmy
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera.  Out of the box, very nice looking camera and felt very durable.  Took fair pictures on land of non-moving objects.  However, when I took it out in the water for action shots, the camera failed miserably. First, it takes 5 seconds from the time you press the power button to capturing pictures.  So I had to keep the camera on the entire time (overwise I would missed spontaneous moments) which drained the battery quickly.  Secondly, the shutter lag (from the time you press the shutter button to the time you actually capture to picture) is over 1 second, which doesn't seem like much, but in reality, it translates into a lot of missed perfect moments.  A shutter lag of over a second is painfully long.  All of my pictures were slightly out of focus.  And all of the action photographs were blurry.  Video in and out of water is fair, not great.  Also painfully slow to start up the video capture.

Reviews.Title: bad camera
Reviews.Author: Rudy Widjaja "Rudy Widjaja"
Reviews.Content: well, this is not the first camera I have but it is the first camera from Olympus brand.yes the camera is sturdy and well build (sorta).so I took this camera to go swimming.day1. perform well.day 2, developed moisture in the inside camera (we go out in the summer, so it is humid, and in the room is cold from A/C)day 3. the camera having problem to focus, because the lense is full of humidity/foggy. so I decided to bake it in the Sun. 1/2 day, the smudge seems to go away, but can't view the screen /the LCD just don't want to go off. but I can still take pictures.day 4. the camera complained that it has no power left (battery drained) but I just complete the charge. so I decided to recharge. 5 min, it says it completed the charge.I took out and the power don't even want to turn on. then there are moisture all over the place (the lense, the flash, the inside of the LCD)so I decided to bake it again, 2 days.now it just a door stopper. I'll try to see if I can get a battery replacement.Stay tune.

Reviews.Title: Boot time and shutter speed
Reviews.Author: Madness
Reviews.Content: Hello all I just wanted to let you know that there is a new firmware version 1.1 you can download from Olympus's website this makes the boot maybe 1 and a half seconds to 2 seconds tops and they removed the splash screen.. Also those who complained about the show shutter in program mode there is no delay and in auto if you hold the shutter button down halfway it will get all the auto focus stuff out of the way and it also has no delay that I can notice.

Reviews.Title: Great rugged little camera
Reviews.Author: R. Merikle
Reviews.Content: It seems the reviews for this camera are all over the map. I think you need to understand what this camera was made for. It was made to be a rugged waterproof camera. This is the third camera I have tried of this type and I can say without a doubt this is the best one so far. I got a good price on it and would be more disappointed if I paid more, but for what I paid I think this camera is a great value.What this camera is... This camera is rugged and waterproof and therefore sacrifices need to be made. Yes the software in the camera is slow. Yes it can be somewhat slow in between photos. BUT It takes great photos especially when you are outdoors. Color reproduction is good and it does what I want it to which is take photos in, around or near water without worrying. No it is not perfect, but again compared to other rugged cameras it is by far the best I have used so far at this price point. This thing is built like a tank and if you read the reviews there are very few people that have had problems with water issues. Just remember to let the camera and your hands completely dry before you open this camera and you should be fine. You should be thinking hours for this process, not minutes.What this camera is NOT...This camera is not my DSLR that has very expensive lenses and allows me to take photos that can be blown up to very large sizes and take production ready photos. But I would never take my DSLR where I would take this camera. It also is not my wifes very nice little point and shoot camera that has a 1,000x zoom with great noise and camera software. However we have already replaced her camera once because it broke just from being in her purse. The DSLR and my wife's pocket cameras are the ones we pull out when we are home and traveling close by to a friend's house for example. This camera is the one you take with you to the pool, lake or go on a cruise with.What this camera excels at is it matches our active lifestyle. We enjoy taking the dog to the lake, we enjoy the beach, river, and any other body of water. I bought this specifically for a cruise we are going on. I wanted something I could throw in my shorts pocket and not worry about no matter what adventure we go on and this fits the bill.In closing if you DON'T need rugged then yes there are better point and shoots out there and you should look else where. And you would have to be crazy to compare this to a DSLR. All the negative reviews I just don't think understood what they were buying. Heck if someone can point me to a rugged little camera that is a better value then this at this price point then please let me know. Otherwise I will be out there shooting great photos and capture video from time to time and not worry about every little drop of water or if it gets brushed up against something while it sits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mommy R.N.
Reviews.Content: This camera has gotten a lot of bad reviews for it's speed....I have a very nice Nikon camera and it performs like it should...that being said you get what you pay for. It is slower than my Nikon, but is also a fraction of the price. We wanted a camera that takes good pictures, is durable, and easy to travel with-and it's everything we wanted. If you want a camera that has the speed and features of an expensive camera-you have to buy the expensive camera :)

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Deidre M. Quinn "dee"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something to snorkel with in Kauai.This was on sale and seemed to be my best option for the price.It's pretty heavy, but it's made of metal so at least I know it can take a hit!I smacked the screen on a rock pretty good and there is just the teeny tiniest scratch but everything else is fine!We (my husband and I) heard this camera was slow, but its not any different from any other point and shoot I've ever used. We put a class 10 memory card in and that made it a little faster.I love the option to use super macro with a light! Its amazing! Now you can take close up pictures in poor lighting.Thats the main reason I got this over the 310 (my husband has the 310).I love that the RECORD button is there rather than finding REC in the options menu like some cameras.Now I can take a video and go right back to taking pictures (this is especially nice under water!).The screen was visible under water, but sometimes a glare from the sun got in the way.It was on the beach for 2 weeks, It never got sand in it, it was tough, it took nice pictures and stayed waterproof!I do wish the battery life was better. The battery drains pretty quick!I plan to purchase an additional battery to switch out.I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, Weak battery
Reviews.Author: CPR
Reviews.Content: Camera is pretty decent for a high impact point and shoot.  Im adjusting from using my dSLR, so I need to get used to the lag time between when you push the shutter button and the photo is actually taken.The underwater feature works fabulous.  This is one of the main reasons I got this camera.  I took it on vacation with us to Maui and used it fearlessly on the beach and in the ocean.  Went down to depths of about 20ft, so I didnt test the full range of the camera.  The underwater photos and video turn out great.  I was really impressed.  The image on the viewfinder while taking the photos is drab, but good color comes out in the actual photos.Some pictures taken when using the flash will cause some snowflake (hexagon) images on the photos.  Not sure how to remedy that.My biggest complaint is the battery life.  I am glad I bought a spare battery, because I could easily go through one battery in just a couple hours of shooting.  I had to switch batteries mid-day a couple times.  And it does not come with an external battery charger, so I cant charge one battery while Im using the other.  I have to use the camera to charge the battery.  Maybe there is an OEM charger out there somewhere, but I havent looked yet.Overall Id give it 4/5.

Reviews.Title: Camera Leaked On 2nd Use
Reviews.Author: Wilber Bergado "techboy57"
Reviews.Content: I just got the Olympus 8010 last month and yesterday was only the 2nd time I've used it in the ocean. Sadly to say, the camera stop working because moisture had gotten inside. I had also purchased the floating strap with it and I had the camera in my pocket while snorkeling. The camera came out of my pocket and I found the floating strap close by with no camera attached! I'm not sure how it got separated from the strap but the camera is now a total loss. The only way I will buy another camera to take underwater is if I also buy the special underwater housing made for it. Yes, I now that that may also leak but at least you can test it first. I've also read from other reviews that if the camera leaks, Olympus will not fix it under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Good family camera
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Mom
Reviews.Content: So far we have used this camera for tubing down a river and snorkeling on Grand Cayman and it has been great.  The kids can grab it and take pictures and we don't have to worry if they drop it, and they have.  It has been in the water a lot and has shown no leakage.  It does help your picture quality if you learn the settings.  The automatic setting does not do as well.  We also have gotten some good video in and out of the water.This has been a great family camera for us.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for busy families
Reviews.Author: nfo1203
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera because we're a very active family. We spend most of our time outdoors and on occassion leave things within reach of our smaller, more destructive, children. It's not uncommon to find our house phone in the backyard, covered in dew, or hear the tv remote bouce off a wall because someone thought it could fly...life with four kids from ages 3 to 7 is busy and unpredictable. What better camera to have than one that is shock, water and crush proof?! We're still getting used to all the fun features but by far the best is the HD video. Recording video was never as easy as it is with this camera. There's a designated record button so that you never mistakenly record video when you wanted to take a photo or visa versa. We haven't tested all the proofs just yet but time will tell. So far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Great but slow...
Reviews.Author: scott fahdt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Canon D10 Powershot, which failed the very first time I took it into the water. I'm happy with my purchase, but this camera is terribly slow between pictures, which has caused me to miss a fair amount of shots.Other than the speed issue, this is a good, tough camera for all my adventures.

Reviews.Title: Alternatives then?
Reviews.Author: N. J. Schreiber "Dreadneck13"
Reviews.Content: For the people giving low ratings could you please suggest a point and click camera in the same price range that is a better choice, one that can go underwater without a special housing?We have two of these cameras , we live near the ocean and we Kayak and snorkel allot so we wanted a camera we can take to the beach and underwater and just let it hang around our kayaks.This camera is awesome! handles the water, sand and heat like nothing. the pictures and video look great. I am sure I can buy a more expensive camera and a water proof housing but I don't want to and for the price I don't think this camera can be beat.Granted when I'm not at the beach, kayaking or water-parks I will take my Sony or Nikon cameras along but for water and beach activity the Olympus Tough is the only one for the job.

Reviews.Title: Tough in name only, soft in everything else
Reviews.Author: Photo Guy from the North
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Stylus 8010 after having great luck with the 8000 series camera from Olympus. I was excited about the High Definition video capabilities and the 14 megapixel upgrade.What I got was a camera that was built to be tough but was soft inside and out.The picture quality was always soft. I couldn't get good colors or crisp images and lens flare was always a problem.And then the pins inside the camera bent when putting a Secure Digital card inside. After two months I couldn't believe it. The retailer sales rep had never heard of anything like that with any SD-based camera either. I got a new one and within two weeks I had the same problem.The only thing that was a positive was the video quality which outside with good light was fun to record but I wouldn't call it amazing quality.If you want a tough camera get the Olympus 8000 series instead. I owned one of those and was happy with it until I gave it to a family member.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: S. Haber
Reviews.Content: Great camera when it works. But Olympus has terrible customer service so when the camera is damaged in the water just after the one year mark, it's apparently the customer's fault since the seal was "supposed" to be replaced. This camera has been damaged on way too many occasions, all when I'm in shallow waters. Such a shame, but I won't be purchasing from Olympus ever again.

Reviews.Title: Beware - Amazon has listed the wrong memory card for this item.  You need an SD memory card not an XD.
Reviews.Author: Script "script27"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Much heavier then the Stylus 790 SW.  Amazon has this item paired (as of 4/30/2010) with the XD memory card.  This is the wrong memory card.  The camera takes an SD memory card.

Reviews.Title: Olympus cameras - Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: TDG Fort Worth Tx
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews unless the product is that bad.  Don't let that metal case fool you!  I've taken thousands of photos with various brands of high-quality cameras over the past 35 years and have never been more dissatisfied than I am today with OLYMPUS cameras.  I gave OLYMPUS the benefit of the doubt when the first Stylus waterproof camera drowned upon it's first shallow dunking.  OLYMPUS offered to replace that camera with the STYLUS TOUGH 8010 for a price about double what I would pay for the same thing online.  I bought the STYLUS TOUGH 8010 online instead of going through the pathetic OLYMPUS customer service.  I am already having problems with the OLYMPUS STYLUS 8010.  If you really want to take more than a handfull of photos per year, please stay away from OLYMPUS cameras.  You have a lot of options.  Their advertised toughness is marketing hype to make you think you are getting more than just megapixals.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Tough - 8010 shock and water proof camera
Reviews.Author: NM
Reviews.Content: What a camera!!! Have used this both for taking swimming pool photo's and video's and for salt water photos's and video's. I can't fault the quality of the results or the camera.The picture is always clear and the camera functions are easy to select.An excellent choice of camera for those normally hazardous shots

Reviews.Title: Adventure's Dream; It Is Ultra Durable w/ Amazing Support
Reviews.Author: T. Croke
Reviews.Content: After breaking three cameras in a four month period I wanted something that could take a beating and this camera has delivered. After 7 months it has survived: - Below Freezing Temperatures Continuously for 2 weeks. - Fording Flood Stage Rivers in my pocket - Accidentally being dropped off a 20 foot cliff onto a soft ground - Caving (spelunking) in wet and dry conditions. - Accidental drop of 2 feet onto concrete then falling down 2 concrete stadium stairs - Underwater up to 15 feet in ocean, freshwater and pools for up to an hour at a time - Backpacking trips - 35 foot cliff jumping in my pocket - And most recently: being knocked out of my hand at an outdoor concert in the rain and kicked around by the crowd; found the next day.In ALL these things it was taking pictures with no problem before and afterward.Customer ServiceI did break the camera a month ago. It was surprisingly from a 2 foot drop onto pavement: it cracked the LCD screen (it still took pictures although I couldn't see what I was shooting). After contacting customer support I shipped it for repair. From first contact to receiving the fixed camera back was 7 days! Plus the fix was free because it failed under normal conditions and was under warranty.Good: - Durable, waterproof - Good picture quality (takes getting use to) - 5X optical zoom - Fast & Helpful Customer Support - Approximately 400 High Resolution Pictures internal memory capacity - Approximately 250 High Resolution Pictures per battery chargeBad: - Sluggish Start Up - The buttons on the rear are metal covered plastic that wears off - Indoors pictures typically blur (this seems an Olympus problem in general)Picture QualityAt first I was disappointed with the picture quality, as it seemed poor. However after about a month of use I was able to easily and fully compensate for how the camera operates and take great quality pictures. That being said, it is not SLR quality, but comparable to other point and shoots.Nuts & BoltsThis camera is prefect for those of us who want to throw the camera in our pocket, go and not worry about it. Because of this I take pictures that few others get because they are worried about their camera. Whether it is at the beach, on a mountain trail, or in a blizzard I can take out my camera and get the amazing shots. Plus, I can get to spots no one else can take a picture from. (Ex: Many people take pictures of people jumping off the cliff, but few would get pictures from in the water looking up as someone jumps.)This camera has outdone my expectations and truly is an adventure's dream. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Clueless in California
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty much what I was looking for: small, light, easy to use, great photos.  The only negative is that it is difficult to hold it so that part of your hand doesn't cover the lense, something I didn't realize until I looked at the photos later.  If you don't want to worry about this issue, consider obtaining one of those micro tripods that can double as a "handle" for the camera.  I found you do NOT need one of these to steady the shot, but it makes it so that your hand isn't actually trying to hold the camera and it elimnates the problem of covering the lense.  I found the user interface easy to use, HOWEVER your settings are not kept for the next time you turn on the camera. This makes it more difficult to take spontaneous shots, since you might have to pause to set your options prior to the shot.  This got a little annoying, but was workable. If you want updates to the OS you have to download the photo shop that comes with your camera and register it online.  I had difficulties registering my camera, and the help desk at Olympus was less than helpful.  I eventually dumped the Olympus photo program in lieu of other programs I had access to.  I haven't yet used this underwater, although that is planned for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera, Amazing pictures!The pictures on the camera itself looked pretty descent. But once I uploaded them to my computer the quality was amazing. I think its just the screen on the camera isn't that great.I took this camera to the beach and in the middle of pushing the button to take the picture a wave knocked me over. The picture still came out perfect!I am super pleased I bought this camera, it has lots of functions and extras for you to mess around with if you want.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Bstewart
Reviews.Content: I had a previous version of this camera that was awesome.  I had the camera for over 3 years and unfortunately lost it in a taxi cab on a trip about 5 months ago.  I decided to replace it with the latest and greatest Olympus version.  I had praised my previous camera to everyone I knew.  However, here are the things that I have found about this latest 8010 version.1. First, a large percentage of the time, this camera will NOT focus.  You will point this camera at everything in the frame and continue to get the sad sound of no focus.  This is a very irritating point.2. Second you will have to wait approximately 1 to 2 seconds after you push the shutter release before it will take a picture.  If you are trying to "catch" a memory on film, then forget it.3. The battery life is atrocious and you can't replace the battery or buy an extra.  You charge the camera by plugging the whole camera in the wall.  However, I think I found the reason that the battery has no usable life span.  With the camera on auto, the flash, flashes, on every photo regardless of how much light you have available.  Test this by pointing the camera at a light fixture and take a picture or take it outside on a sunny day and take a picture and you will see that the flash fires.  It tries to use the lowest shutter speed possible but even with a shutter speed of 125 or 250, the flash still fires.  I personally believe that this is the primary reason for the lack of battery life.4. The image quality is not commiserate of a 14mp camera.  Many of my photos are washed out and not even usable whereas my older version had people gasping at how amazing they were!I sent the camera off to have it "repaired" with my full list of complaints only to have it returned with no documentation on what they found or what they fixed.  I took it out of the box and immediately found that the flash still fires on every photo.  Go figure.I bought this from Best buy and even though I have the reciept, I don't believe that I have any recourse.  If I did, I'd return it and exchange it for a different camera all together.I believe that these are the toughest cameras out there, but if they don't perform and bring home the pictures, then they are not worth the money.I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: my cell phone takes better pictures, only Pro is it's waterproof
Reviews.Author: L. Conrado Barajas Pedraza
Reviews.Content: All the Pics are grained, it may be acceptable if you reduce it's size 4 times, but at 14 Megapixels natural it's like making a 2 MP photo, seven times bigger using paint, i tried every option and read all the owner's manual, there's no way to get better pics, it has very low quality in colors and sharpness, also the lens is so much in the corner that you can't hold it without getting your finger in the picture, if it wasn't because i need an underwater camera, i would return this item, or maybe I will... if I found another one with better picture quality. I guess it's just too much to ask Image Quality and Waterproof in the same camera, If you need that better get a Nikon and an underwater housing.hope this review helps someone.

Reviews.Title: Very Tough, Horrible Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Rogers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got this camera for a 9-month trip around the world.  We thought we could take this one along on days when we'd be adventuring in the outdoors and didn't want to take along the nice Nikon SLR.  Now that we're 6 months into the trip, I've found we absolutely never take this camera along with us because the pictures are so bad and so worthless, we might as well not even have it.  I will say that it is tough and hasn't given us any problems in the water.  However, every single shot in water and on land is grainy and washed out.  Shots taken indoors look like the people are ghosts in a snowstorm.  We've tried a number of different settings for all kinds of situations and there are a few combinations that produce at best mediocre pictures.  This camera replaced an $80 point-and-shoot from Kmart that we had for many years and that camera took Ansel Adams shots compared with this one.  Honestly, don't buy it.  Unless you want to but it from us....

Reviews.Title: Stop working after some uses
Reviews.Author: Nguyen Trung Ky
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year of August, but rarely use it. Up to now I used only three times, that is when I go with family for vacations. Last month the camera stopped working. Every time I turn on the camera, it turns on just a few seconds and then shutdown. I checked online but never see a solution for this. What should I do with it now but throwing to the gabbage?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Morabit
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a non waterproof Sony.  Nothing wrong with the Sony, just wanted a tough waterproof camera.  This is a bit bigger and slightly heavier, but I have taken it in the ocean and white water rafting (class III-IV) and the pictures come out great!

Reviews.Title: outstanding!
Reviews.Author: chico
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera about a month prior to going on a cruise with my wife. I bought a neck lanyard and wore it to every shore excursion we had. On waterslides,in pools, on tubes, in the beach...and performed perfectly! was a little leary the first time it got wet but it did great! AWESOME camera!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Damian Comisso
Reviews.Content: The camera has a good look and feel, it's very rugged and the weight is just right. Now, what really disappointed me was the auto-focus feature. It doesn't perform well under low light, specially indoors. You have to make several attempts to get the camera to focus. Also the menus are not user friendly.

Reviews.Title: tough but low photo quality
Reviews.Author: joseph kuah
Reviews.Content: i use it to take photos for my open water diver students.the photo quality is as others have reviewed, not good.once i accidentally brought it to 12m, lucky for me no leak.while about its durability, i've brought it for >30 dives now, i'll see how long will it last.rank it 4star as it's cheap (u get what u paid for) and it's convenient since it can go to 10m without a casing.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof ... but for how long?
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey A. Petrasek "Artep"
Reviews.Content: I have/had an Olympus Stylus model 1050. It is poorly designed, requires annual maintenance, and takes a lousy picture. The worst design feature is the sliding lens cover. Upon sliding the cover down, the camera is on. The problem is, just putting the camera away in its case can cause an inadvertant dead battery. I can't count the number of times I've pulled out what should have been a fully charged camera, and found the cover open and the battery dead. My camera died after being splashed on a raft trip. Seems it's only waterproof as long as the seals are replaced annualy. So be prepared for the yearly maintenance and the yearly cost ($$). It's my first Olympus and my last.

Reviews.Title: Furious!!!
Reviews.Author: nmm7of9
Reviews.Content: I returned my camera to Olympus to have the seals replaced (as recommended by the manufacturer) and now they say they won't replace the seals and they WON'T return the camera!!! I am FURIOUS - it seems the only reason is that the camera is an older model. If I had any idea they might keep my camera, I would have never sent it in!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Matt "MattMatt"
Reviews.Content: I expected better results for the price. This camera is practically useless. Many pictures came out blurry even though I was holding the camera super still. The flash is worthless. It flashes so bright that it drowns out the picture. I took a close-up picture of a part in a dim area to get a model/serial number. The flash drowned out the entire picture where I couldn't even see the object - just white light! Then I pulled out my HTC Windows phone and snapped a picture and it came out perfect.I bought this camera specifically for waterproof, but what good is that if the camera can't take a decent picture? Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: not working after a year and half :(
Reviews.Author: Gabcalik "Gabcalik"
Reviews.Content: I took my camera for underwater pictures and I made sure I double locked the camera so no water gets inside and it was working for first few minutes and than it froze on me. Water still got inside the camera and it is NOT working anymore. I just bought an extra battery to find out if is not just a battery issue and still NOT WORKING :((

Reviews.Title: Its a good thing this camera is tough because Ive slammed it on the ground.
Reviews.Author: J. Harrison
Reviews.Content: Im not a professional camera user.  I need it to take photos of puppies and kids.  When I press the button to take a photo it should snap the photo but it wont do it untill seconds later...which is to late. When I do get a good photo.. its shiney and looks very digital. I love that this camera is though but its horrable.  Its a horrable camera for me and it waists my time.

Reviews.Title: 8010 Tough great
Reviews.Author: UD
Reviews.Content: As I already have a 610 which is nearly identical, the short comings come as no surprise.  This camera is great if you want a "GOOD" camera for general point and shoot with the capability of decent underwater shots.  My daughter and I have taken some GREAT shots with the two cameras.  The short coming is that if you want to take an action shot the shutter is way too slow.  You actually need to know early what is going to happen in advance in an event and hit the shutter release early.  Once you know that you can get very good pics.  I bought two...so after the first one I knew what to expect....Good Durable underwater camera!  I have two because my daughter and I can't be underwater seeing the same things at the same time and we each needed one.  UD

Reviews.Title: works like it should
Reviews.Author: ersurfer999
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photography person, or a camera guy. I am an adventure guy, and so far this thing has really survived anything ive put it into. From Natural Hot Springs, to freezing cold waters this has held up perfectly. It also survived a bad catch when my buddy decided to throw it off a cliff. its a little scratched, but it works! The panoramic comes out great, and ive taken it 25ft deep scuba diving, held up no prob. I would recommend this camera if your looking for an uncomplicated point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Jersey Girl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year and a half ago---and I can sadly say that I am throwing it in the trash. I took it into the ocean with me and after one shot, the camera became inoperable. I understand that there are risks and not everything that pro-ports to be waterproof actually is--but beyond the catastrophic failure, I found that the camera overexposed pictures on land that should have been crystal sharp---that is of course if the subject I was shooting waited long enough for the darn camera to power itself on. I also found the camera to be difficult to set.  Why did I give it 2 stars---well I thought that it took nice video for a camera.  But do yourself a favor and stay away

Reviews.Title: My 3rd Tough
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: My 3rd Olympus Tough and I buy these for one reason...I'm not a photographer but I love to take pictures. I don't get into all the specs. I want something simple, tough, and easy to interface with my computer. It does all of the above. Some may find it to be complex or not the most friendly to use. But if I can;t break it then the normal human certainly can't.

Reviews.Title: Horrible focus problems
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera has major problems with focus. I've purchased two waterproof Olympus products, this one and the prior model.  The prior model had absolutely no focus issues.  However, this camera, particularly when attempting to focus on objects far away, cannot focus. I recently took it on a trip to Asia and lost about a quarter of my pictures because of this.  Not at all worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: moore777
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for the first time underwater. It was only about 1 foot underwater, which is much less than the max, and it is now ruined. It will not even turn on. I messaged the company and their only advice was that I should have replaced the waterproof seals. The camera also cracked the screen from dropping it 3 feet, which should not happen either. In addition, it takes an extremely long time to take pictures in dim light. It is not a fast camera in great lighting either though.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. IT IS NOT SHOCKPROOF OR WATERPROOF. There are many better options out there for you. I wish I would have known this before buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: The cheaper older model is better
Reviews.Author: Jane Doe "Devlina66"
Reviews.Content: I'm no picture pro but I like to hike with my camera and have something that will fit in a pocket to take to parties and shows that won't weight me down but will take better pictures than my phone.  this in not that camera.  I had the older version of this camera and it worked great.  not the thing for indoor pictures but it took a decent picture for what I used it for.  This new version catches flares on the screen and has odd (maybe) tempered glass flare over pictures taken outdoors.  The indoor shots are overexposed (no matter what flash setting I put it on) and not worthy of print.  Overall I would just look at other tough cameras next time.  I was really sad this one wasn't a new and improved version of the last.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality, Movies/Toughness only saving grace.
Reviews.Author: Justin Irving
Reviews.Content: There are better "tough" cameras out there for significantly less money. The thing that really disappoints about this camera is that it's clearly a software issue. Olympus needs to fix the software or someone with some skillz needs to hack this baby, cause it has a lot of potential. Just allowing a manual mode would be a big improvement. In the meantime anyone who cares about their pictures should look else where.

Reviews.Title: This Camera was a Savior!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "texaswalker"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for my sons Make a Wish trip to the Bahamas because we would be around sand and in the water all the time, I wanted to document the trip well.  It took awesome photos, clear and beautiful, above and under water.  I bought the little float that is an accessory and I had that clipped to my wrist the entire time.  OK, so the last day of the trip we were snorkeling in about 50-75 feet of water and what did I see when I got in the water but my camera floating to the bottom of the ocean with all of my awesome pictures.  The cord on the float broke in half. I was so upset, I literally sucked in about a gallon of salt water.  To my luck and Gods grace, there was a boat of scuba divers right next to us and a lady on the boat went down and picked up the camera.  Due to the pressure of the water that deep, the crystal was cracked and I just knew the card was ruined too.  When we got back to the hotel, you'll never guess but the camera came on and continued working until we got finished with the entire trip and to the airport and then it finally kicked it.  However, every photo was there and I couldn't fault the camera, it did more than it was advertised to do.  Now, the handstrap float?  Ridiculous.  That needs to be designed with a cord that will not tear and give it a good breakaway clip in case of emergency.  I love this camera, and so I bought another one.  I actually like the beautify feature.  It does a great job with no need to go the photo edit software and makes me look 10 years younger....lol.

Reviews.Title: sadly, this camera has gone down in quality
Reviews.Author: mickedy
Reviews.Content: i owned the olympus stylus tough 1030sw for many years and absolutely LOVED it!  it's still working great, but due to something that is my fault, it's no longer waterproof.  for that reason, i ordered a second camera to have on-hand and figured why change brands/models when i was so pleased w/ my olympus 1030sw.  so i ordered the olympus stylus tough 8010 and was excited to have the same camera as my previous one, but with upgraded features and quality.i was truly disappointed when i tried out the new camera for the first time.  the settings are very difficult to get right w/o having everything being white-washed in the photo.  and on MANY occasions, the camera wouldn't even focus and i ended up with blurry pics.  the only fix i found for this was to turn off the camera and turn it back on....which is a very slow process.  this camera is much slower than my 1030sw.i am returning this camera.  greatly disappointed to see that olympus has decreased the quality of such a great model camera from previous years.  would love to go back to them if they get the next model right.  but for now, i'm going with the sony or panasonic waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love this camera
Reviews.Author: R. Bruce "kiapet.com"
Reviews.Content: So I've been a loyal Canon user for ages, till my canon elphs when floating down the rivers..  I then found my first stylus that was water resistant, that worked great for snowboarding.. then along came the ssw 770 and loved it, then something else as 10meg, and now this 8010 and it's a dream. I like the 720vid, also you can ZOOM in while you shoot video.. now granted the stills aren't as great colorwise as other cameras, but the others can't take the beating and elements like this camera can !!!  Here are a few vids shot with this camera [...] the last video I just mounted the camer on the boards with a gorrila mini pod and some duct tape ;0)

Reviews.Title: tough camera
Reviews.Author: Arctic Man
Reviews.Content: Pro> its a tough camera which i carry into backwoods Alaska as well as to work in the Arctic. It takes good pics. I have not blown any pics up to large size. I didn't experience any of the connection port problems others have reported, i think those who did just don't know how to plug cords in carefully, they only fit one way.Con> It does as others have described have a lag in shutter speed.I bought this camera to replace my Stylus 410 and for me I'd rather have my 410 because i don't need all the fancy gadgets just a point and shoot. After 6 months i still have not taken the time to go thru all that this camera can do.

Reviews.Title: Workhorse
Reviews.Author: Filigree
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera.Things I like** This camera is a sturdy workhorse of a pocket point-and-shoot.** I've enjoyed the internal panoramic-photo option, where the photo is taken and stitched together on the spot. (It's a little slow, but so long as you're not in a huge rush, it's all kinds of fun.)Things I don't like** Operation is slow and shutter response are slow. Changing settings (such as in and out of macro mode) is all done via a menu system rather than with external switches or buttons.** Camera developed condensation inside the lens after less than a week using it underwater at a maximum depth of 10 feet, though the specs say it's good to 10 meters. I will submit it for a warranty repair.

Reviews.Title: slooooooooow foooocusing
Reviews.Author: Piotr Kozikowski "Studio"
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with many others who complained about focusing and how slow the camera is, can't count the shots I have missed because this camera either wouldn't focus at all (and I know what I am doing as a long time hobby photographer) or was so slow that the subject was out of the frame by the time the pic was taken.Returned it to the store and replaced it with panasonic TS3, much happier with this one but haven't had a chance to test it under water yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to accompany us to the Bahamas on our honeymoon. Our guidelines for a camera were one that was sturdy, waterproof, and had good megapixels. We researched many cameras and decided that this was the one for us. The underwater shots looked great. Several times we went snorkeling with this camera, the pictures are just as clear as the water and the video was decent. Above water, the pictures rivaled those of the SLR cameras. Except for the most discerning individuals, the pictures were the same quality. The only issue I have with the camera is that occasionally the autofocus was a bit off but with a quick reshoot, the picture was just as we wanted it. Another person's review stated that moisture entered her camera. In order to resolve the issue, the camera was placed in the sun. Typically electronics do not enjoy a tan. When not in use, our camera was placed in the shade. On the side of the camera is a locking mechanism with gaskets to prevent water from entering. Always prior to entering the water, I ensured that the lock was engaged. No problems. Make sure to clean it as per the instructions each time it gets wet in order to maintain the water resiliency. A bit of upkeep provides for great working order.

Reviews.Title: it's a great camera buuuuutttt.....
Reviews.Author: tealeyez
Reviews.Content: I own other Olympus Stylus cameras.  As far as it being waterproof,freeze proof, tough, blah blah blah... yup all of that is true and it's a great camera.  BUT the downloading of the pictures onto the computer is endless and when you download a video?  I hope you have plenty of time...  Watching the video you download is another issue.  If and when you ever get to watch it, it will freeze up your computer and you have to start all over again.I did not return the camera, it takes great pictures, instead, I download my pictures to another application instead of the "IB" it comes with.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: kalebnicu
Reviews.Content: I use this camera all the time in the pool and at the beach.  It is fantastic!  Takes great pictures above and below the water.  The camera has lots of settings for different shooting conditions that are easy to navigate.  My most recent experience with it was on a 5 day hiking trip in Hawaii.  Unlike most of my friends who did not have water proof cameras I was able to keep my camera in easy reach in the rugged terrain.  When it rained I was the only one taking pictures.  At the beach I sat it on the sand to put snorkle gear on and a big wave came and washed sand all over it (Had the Olympus floating strap attached).  No problem, just rinsed it off in the ocean and kept going.  One of my friends had a cheap water proof disposable camera, not digital so cant share the pictures that easy.  Another friend had a waterproof case for his camera and the extra covering over the lense caused glare on alot of the pitures.  Also, he had to bother with taking the camera in and out of the case which was bulky and if any sand, dirt, or debris gets in the seal then the case is no longer water tight.  This camera is a win win and well worth getting.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater and kids, not fast for photos
Reviews.Author: EMT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for travel, kayaking, swimming, snorkeling, and diving.  It is great for all of those purposes, as long as you don't forget to rinse the salt water off.  We have taken hundreds of great videos and photos of our baby swimming underwater.On land, I use a SLR camera with a 50mm fixed portrait lens for kid photos.  It is very fast.  The Stylus is not a fast camera, but it's kidproof-ness and underwater quality are excellent.  If you are planning to take a lot of photos while snorkelling and want a nice photo of a rare fish, look for a faster camera or perhaps a waterproof case for a regular camera.  If you are mostly interested in underwater movies or water sports and need a rugged camera, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really want an underwater pocket sized camera that will take decent pictures underwater and good to great pictures elsewhere.  This 14 megapixel camera does not take good enough pictures when set on 5 or 8 megapixels to make it worth the purchase.  I took lots of pictures during a week of use before I returned it.  I only took a few pictures under fresh water and it worked but I did not use it at any depth.  The stray camera noise that was captured when in video mode made the videos almost worthless.  Olympus should have concentrated on a GREAT camera with smaller picture size (say a 10 megapixel camera) instead of pushing the picture size to 14 megs at the expense of poor picture quality.  The menu options were awkward to use.  On burst setting it did a nice job of quickly taking several (not great quality) pictures.  I am not a camera expert by any means however I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Overall the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 is a decent camera.  However, I was expecting more from this camera.  I already own the Olympus 790 SW (7.1 MP with 3x zoom) but after 3 years was having some issues with the optics.  I decided to upgrade to the 8010 14MP camera with a 5x zoom.  I loved the waterproof feature of the 790 and the 8010 is rated to an even deeper 33 feet.  I was expecting the 8010 to have many improvements over the 790, but this is not true.When taking a photo there is about a 3 second delay before the image previews on the display.  My older, less expensive Olympus camera had the images come up immediately.  Even when I reduce the resolution from 14MP to 8MP the problem persists.  (I'm using a Sandisk 8GB class 6 HDSC card rated at 20MB/S) Some of the other down sides to this camera are:1. The camera does not come with an external battery charger.  You have to charge the battery in the camera.  This makes it impossible to charge a depleted  battery while still using the camera.  I opted to by the Olympus charger for an extra $30 bucks.2.  There is no manual that comes with the camera.  I have tried to download it from the official Olympus site with no avail.3.  The menus for the different scene selection modes are inferior to previous Olympus camera models.  Where the 790 had a photo for each different scene, the 8010 has a small icon with a brief  description for the scene.4.  The button to turn the camera on is not easy to press.  I suppose this is to inhibit the camera from being turned on by accident, but I never had that problem with the 790 which was much easier to turn on.5.  The camera is a bit heavier and bulkier than my previous model.On the plus side, the 8010 takes very nice underwater pictures and videos.  I've used it in the swimming pool several times.  I'm never afraid to get the camera wet at the pool or the beach.  This is the main reason that I purchased the 8010.  Although I've never dropped the camera, it does feel very sturdy.  And, the picture quality is really very nice.If you're looking for a camera that you can take in or near the water, the 8010 is a good bet.  You'll just have to get used to the slow response time for previewing the photos.  You can probably get used to the bad menus and the difficult on/off button, but if you want to charge a battery while still using the camera you'll have to spring for a new external charger (that used to be included).

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Tough 8010
Reviews.Author: David L. Van Amburg "Mustang"
Reviews.Content: This thing is really built rugged and the compartment door (now only 1 door)has been improved.  We bought this camera to replace a Stylus 770SW that went swimming with the battery door open.  Fried everything.  The new camera is poorly documented out of the box, so it will take a long time to figure out settings and just what it can do.  I need a hard copy manual that I can touch as I'm learning and refreshing my memory on settings.  Don't have it with the new camera.  The battery and media has changed and now takes a different battery and charger than the old camera and it uses SD instead of XD media.  I have no preference to either battery or media but dislike the fact that Olympus changed it.  Now we need to maintain both types of media and batteries.  The 8010 so far, is real slow at capturing shots and even slower recovering.  I'm going to miss a lot of pictures with this camera.  The video function has improved in that to shoot a video now it is a one step process that requires only pressing the red button on the back.  You do not have to change settings to video mode as with the older camera.  I am learning but I am not as pleased with the new camera as I was with the 770SW.  We sent the old camera into Olympus service center and they repaired it and returned it just like new for $115.  Happy days, now the new one can be a back up.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: R Snow
Reviews.Content: I have to say upon opening the package I had high expectations of this product.  As many people have already said the camera tends to be slow in all it's operations.  As a regular user of ruggedized products this tends to be the norm.  It did seem to be a little slower than I expected though.  Taking pictures was a real challenge at first.  One definitely has to be in tune with the various menu options to get a good picture.  The first few days I started snapping photos I was very unhappy with the quality and graininess of all my images.  It took a few days to get use to the controls and having to change the setting for each situation.  Which you will have to do for a good picture.  The only reason I kept this was for it's water proof abilities.  We have a few of these at work for fish work and they work  great underwater for close shots.  The video also seems to work fairly well.  But I spend most of my time in the rain and water so naturally I need my camera to handle that.Battery life is well average.  The main issue if if you have to swap batteries and you're in a wet environment you SOL if you get moisture in the battery/SD Card area.Documentation with this is a joke.  The camera has an attempted built in help library witch seems to irritate more than help.  No real paper manual comes with it.  You can download it or get it off the internal memory on the camera.  It did have about 1.5G free on the internal memory for images, with the rest for the camera OS.All in all if you're looking to use this as an every day shooter look elsewhere.  For someone who needs a camera for there kayak or light duty water sports this may suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera / Poor Battery
Reviews.Author: S. K. Sor
Reviews.Content: This camera is great in every way except for the battery life.  I took it with me to Acadia National Park in Maine and I was completely disappointed by how SHORT battery life is!  If you plan to take a lot of pictures with flash filler to brighten the face, spend an extra $17.99 on a spare battery.  Fortunately, I've a USB port in my minivan to recharge it.  I'm not sure if the seller gave me an old battery or I'm over-using the flash filler, but com'on.  Don't die on me so soon!

Reviews.Title: panorama doesn't seem to work
Reviews.Author: Emily Howell "travelingone"
Reviews.Content: We just got this camera in the mail and immediately tried the panorama feature.  We used the auto feature where it is supposed to automatically stitch two or three pictures into a seamless panorama shot.  We cannot get it to work.  It keeps skipping sections and unevenly stitching the pictures together...  I am not talking slightly off... but way off so you can't really figure out what you are looking at.  I called Olympus twice and told them the problem and both times their immediate response is "of course it works better if you use the PC software to stitch them together."  They acted liked I shouldn't expect the camera to stitch it together well even though that is a feature they advertise.  One women I talked to at Olympus couldn't get her stylus 8010 to stitch pictures together either.  We are sending this one back in and are trying one last time but I am not confident!  IF they don't expect the auto feature to work then why do they have it?  Has anyone had success with this feature?

Reviews.Title: Poor camera- not up to Olympus standard
Reviews.Author: Peter Vize "dpdv"
Reviews.Content: I've owned previous models of the camera and flooded both. Once was my fault. They have improved the seal design and the new model looks like it might have solved the waterproof issues. But... It is simply terrible to use. The autofocus is the worst I have even encountered on ANY camera. The method of selecting the style of image (landscape, portrait etc) is horrible and you need to search through many menu levels everytime you turn the camera on. Forget taking photos quickly. Horrible to use, and on the auto setting keeps choosing underwater mode when trying to photograph a mountain. It is a piece of junk, I'm going to sell it and get a non waterproof model- this is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Terrible experience
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Simmons "camten"
Reviews.Content: Please do not purchase this camera or any other from the Olympus company.  I purchased this camera to take on a white water rafting trip to the Grand Canyon - certainly a once in a lifetime trip.  The camera stopped operating completely on Day 2.  The company has refused any remedy other than to repair the camera at my expense.  Don't quite understand how a "waterproof" and "shockproof" camera can last exactly 24 hours, but the Olympus's rude and unsympathetic response was even worse.  Save your money and give your business to another company

Reviews.Title: Olympus waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: jermwhl "jermwhl"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for almost two years now.  The picture quality on this camera is horrible.  I have never had a camera that has given so many blurry images, especially indoors.  Unless you use the mode selector and use a very specific mode for each scenario, you get very poor quality photos.  The camera doesn't seem to be able to automatically adjust its settings in auto mode.The waterproof portion did work until one of the seals around the lens came off.  I'm not really sure when or how it came off, only that I recently noticed it wasn't there anymore.  Haven't looked into getting it repaired as I am not satisfied with the picture quality.  I am upgrading to the DSC TX-5 instead; it is getting really good reviews all around.In the camera's defense, when it does take a sharp photo, using the mode selector, the pictures are good.  Video is decent, but not over the top, in my opinion.  I am not a photo guru, so I don't know about all shutter speeds, saturation, etc.  I just see a picture and think it is either bad, good, or great.  These photos are good, when they are not blurry.  I would guess that about 40% of the photos I take are blurry.  If the lighting changes, even slightly, while in a scene select mode, the photos come out blurry.  If you can master the scene's mode you may like this camera.  I don't have the patience, I want something that auto detects quickly and accurately.  I have had good luck with other Sonya camera's, and I still wanted a waterproof camera, so I chose the TX-5 as this camera's replacement.I also am not a fan of XD cards, another reason for jumping off the Olympus bandwagon.  I prefer SD.

Reviews.Title: Tough, but nothing else
Reviews.Author: F. J. Sanchez
Reviews.Content: Photo quality is not excellent and for the price that you pay it is not worthy. I mean my older camera or even any other cheap one have better photo quality. I am very disappointed I'm thinking in return it.

Reviews.Title: Best UnderWater Camera on the Marktet
Reviews.Author: unstoppablefamily "Unstoppable Family"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo312147PWQW2K7currentClick) { return cv_mo312147PWQW2K7currentClick(); } } } Length:: 6:53 MinsBeing that are Family is in the middle of 3 Year Trip around the World with our daughter who turns 3 this month, we require a camera that is waterproof and durable. This is is our 4th model of the Olympus Stylus so we are not newbies to this Series, though we are on the simple side of taking photos & videos.The most important features when purchasing such a camera are the following 3 features:1) Waterproof up to 33ft: This is big for us since most of our destinations are for surf and I also like to take it surfing...in Big Waves!2) Shockproof from 6.6ft.
