Between myself, my wife and my little girl...you better believe that there is going to be an occasional drop or 23) Freeze proof down to 14F / -10C If we are not in the waves, we like to go snowboarding in the mountains.Here is the newest of features that had us upgrade to the latest model - High Definition (HD) video. I just purchased the camera over the weekend and have taken amazing HD video while surfing out on the North Shore of Hawaii...and the waves were big and it kept ticking.The 8010 has many features for picture taking though it has been simplified so that anyone can open the box and start taking quality photos & video right out of the box.One feature that I very much enjoy, is the dedicated Camera & Video button so that you do not have to change modes when in action.A disadvantage that I have found is that you have to have your camera plugged in to charge.

Reviews.Title: Water resistant but not waterproof
Reviews.Author: KHD
Reviews.Content: This is my second Olympus stylus.  I had the first on for two years before it leaked while snorkling and died.  I liked the camera and the 8010 model was supposed to be waterproof to 33 feet with an increased pixel count so I got 0ne.  It did a great job while getting splashed and submerged while kayaking but the first time I took it snorkling (after carefully inspecting the seals due to my previous experience) it leaked in less than 10 feet of water.  The camera was one month out of warranty and the only option according to Olympus was repair at a cost of ~$140.  If you are looking for a truly waterproof camera keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted and More.......
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a sturdy camera.  I have no complaints, due to work I have used almost 100 digital cameras this one is as good as any and I can get it wet..... Awesome!!!  Went to Fantasy Fest and took 2500 pictures any pictures that didn't come out great was because of me not the camera.  Perfect camera for the Keys..... Love it.

Reviews.Title: Good Adventure Camera
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I got this camera specifically for taking pictures and videos in and around water. For this it is awesome, the videos come out clear with good sound. The picture quality is good when taking pictures, not great but almost. It seems to take much better pictures outside than inside, but for what the camera is, and for what it was built for I am very impressed. I would not purchase this as your primary camera, my biggest complaint is that there is a LONG delay when taking a picture or starting to take a video. I carry around a Casio Exilim in my purse and the speed at which it takes pictures and recovers is like lightening compared to the Olympus Stylus 8010.Other than the delay in between shots, I don't have a single complaint. I took this thing rafting down class IV and V rapids in which it was repeatedly submerged in water and banged around by rocks and paddles... I also took it diving with me at the Denver Aquarium, everyone was extremely impressed with it, it took fantastic video and I got some great shots, the other divers and instructors were all asking how much it cost and where they could get one. The water resistance has been great, I went diving around 25 feet for about an hour and it did just fine.If you are avid about water sports or are going diving on vacation or something this camera is totally worth it, but I would not purchase this as my primary camera.If you want to see how great the quality is you can check out my scuba video which was taken with this Olympus Stylus-tough 8010  at[...]There are also just still pictures at the very end that were taken underwater.Hope this helps good luck!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy the hype
Reviews.Author: Wild Wood
Reviews.Content: I have been an Olympus customer for a long time, but would think twice about popping over $300 for this camera and its "ad ons".  The camera is slow to start up, you have to check the mode each photo or the photo will likely be blurry.  I am also having a ton of problems with the software, called 'ib', for uploading photos to my laptop.  The ib software basically doesn't seem to work.  It installed successfully, but when you connect the camera to the computer via the USB cable, the ib software starts and either turns the laptop screen black and freezes, or says immediately that "ib has encountered a problem and must close".  I am going back to my reliable 5 mb Olympus and Olympus Master software.  It never failed.  The other irritating thing is that this camera does not come with a manual.  Registering, downloading from Olympus, and seeking out resolutions to problems via the net is just a pain in the a$$ and time consuming.  At least they could have included a manual.

Reviews.Title: Great all around point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: Jtomage
Reviews.Content: I bought this for traveling. i wanted something I could take anywhere and this was perfect. I took it the beach with no problems in the water, out in cold temperatures and more.When I bought it was at a great price, its probably cheaper now which is even better. I did not want to spend too much money on one of these rugged cameras in case it got lost.

Reviews.Title: 2nd one
Reviews.Author: M. Mosher "Mosh"
Reviews.Content: We lost our first Tough 8010 and purchased the exact same model because it's awesome.  The underwater photos are as clear if not clearer that the out of water photos.

Reviews.Title: Don't use in salt water!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Purdy "SouthernGrace"
Reviews.Content: This was my second one of these cause I loved them so much!  BUT...we used this for snorkeling in the ocean and it completely rusted out the screen. We even let it soak in fresh water after each dive as suggested.

Reviews.Title: Indestructible.
Reviews.Author: Jamison Brown
Reviews.Content: Great little tough camera. My second actually. I still have the other but it's been beat around so much I thought a spare was appropriate.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Tobias
Reviews.Content: Please see other review for accessories.  I truly cannot say enough for this camera.  It went to Afghanistan with the Marines, came back battered, but still working.  It matched the claims made for it.  If you really want a great camera that goes through sand, rain, ice, being thrown into a duffel bag with gear, etc., this is the one.  The only thing it missed out on, was being shot.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: JenHol32 "jenhol32"
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Cozumel a few years ago.  I'm not a professional or even experienced amateur when it comes to photography, particularly underwater photography.  This camera was really easy to use.  When snorkeling or in the pool, we used the camera without a separate underwater housing and found the images were very good.  When we went scuba diving we used a plastic housing over the camera.  We used an Ikelite housing, I think.  In any case, it was easy to use the camera with the housing.  It did require familiarizing ourselves with the buttons and operations prior to getting in the water.  Obviously, at this price range, without filters and using ambient light, our pictures and video are very blue.  But we accepted this limitation when we bought it.  The closer we could get to our subject, the better the color.  We used both the photo and video functions.  We were pleased with both.

Reviews.Title: Best water camera for its price
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: This camera can take a beating on many of my outings in the woods or in the ocean this camera withstood the beating of my trips

Reviews.Title: Dont do it
Reviews.Author: nico55
Reviews.Content: the picture quality is too low, it is tough i have put it through hell, but the crap pics and the slow software make it not worth your time, sorry i really wanted this camera to be better

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera to use in sports situations
Reviews.Author: AMAZON FAN
Reviews.Content: We take it along on hikes, and in water sports.  It is slow in a situation that needs a flash.

Reviews.Title: Bring your batteries
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good enough we could use it as our normal camera. It has survived multiple falls, salt water and all kinds of other abuse.  Be sure to have extra batteries though, as they die quickly.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: laraine reedy
Reviews.Content: Good camera but the underwater photos were not true to colo. The functions were decent but there was nothing spectacularly neteworthy about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Okay backup... weak primary.
Reviews.Author: kimberly jacobson
Reviews.Content: Camera is over rated and pictures are NOT amazing quality. It is fine as a back up camera, but I would be very disappointed if this were my primary camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Marika
Reviews.Content: great camera, love it, you can take it anywhere and do anything with it - rain, snow, sun, shine, even under water.Product arrived exactly as described

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: erin crane
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. I really like how i can use it inside and out and it's accident-proof. it's been exactly what i was looking for. it's blue exterior is nice!

Reviews.Title: third camera of this type
Reviews.Author: arthound
Reviews.Content: For the money this is hard to beat.  It goes where I go, from heat of a car in the summer, to photo the running dogs in the winter snow.  It has been damp, as in forgotten outside and still is going.  Normal drops and use is fine.  I use my cameras a lot, and if this is laid down someone will steal it.  I am not the only one to like it.

Reviews.Title: Takes a beating
Reviews.Author: Anne M. Marron
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a year now and it has been dropped and is always with me in the water and not a single problem.  The picture quality is good and it allows me to take pictures i never could take with any of my other cameras.  Though I can not prove this; I believe the bright chrome finish on this camera draws the fish, manatees and dolphin in.  The rear screen is bright enough to be seen in bright FL sun and in many different water conditions.

Reviews.Title: Great camra
Reviews.Author: Justin Perez
Reviews.Content: This camra was amazing great condtion  great qualty and the shipping was fast as well. The  camra take amazing photos and  is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CAMERA OLYMPUS
Reviews.Author: JULIO CESAR ORTA
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA ITS VERY GOOD BECAUSE ITS USED, THE PHOTOS ITS VERY GOOD, IS EASY FOR MANUAL IF THE A BUY NEW  I GIVE  5 STAR

Reviews.Title: don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Abalos
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day backpacking trip in the California Sierras traveling along both the John Muir and Pacific Crest Trails. This is some of the most spectacular backcountry in the US. I took my Olympus Tough TG-810 because it's "shockproof" and "waterproof" -- two things you want on this kind of trip. The only thing it didn't do was take decent video. In fact the quality was utter crap. As soon as I got home I uploaded the still images -- which were ok -- but the video -- the reason I took this camera instead of any of the others I have that can take both still and video images -- was painful to watch. Let me be clear, I spent more than 20 years working in TV production so I know how to use gear and I know how to take quality digital images. In addition to professional digital cameras, I have used point and shoot cameras that shoot both stills and video successfully on many trips; Nikon Coolpix 310 and the 510; Sony Cyber shot W80 (put this one in an underwater housing and used it to shoot very decent diving video) and W650 both w/ Zeiss lenses, . But this camera, and I use that term loosely, was horrible. I knew it while I was shooting. What I was playing back was horrible -- shaky (stabilization?), no consistent focus (nothing ever seems to stay in focus) and the exposure! it was either too hot or under-exposed. No matter what settings I tried the camera shot crap video. There was no way to put it down and pick up another camera -- I was backpacking and had to choose. I chose wrong. Don't make that mistake. There are many "tough" point and shoot cameras on the market that shoot both high quality digital stills and video. This camera is not one of them...and did I forget to mention the price? This is one of the most expensive! I buy Sony and Nikon cameras. I like Canon but haven't owned many. This was the first -- and last Olympus I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Valencia
Reviews.Content: I bought this item in October of 2011 because it's shockproof and waterproof.  While I was on a trip to Cambodia, this year, I dropped it from my hip.  It fell possibly 3ft and is supposed to be shockproof up to 6.6ft  When I picked it up, the screen was purple and all my pictures had lines in it!  One of the most amazing trips of my life and this camera was not able to capture it!  When I called Olympus they told me that the camera is only warranted for 1 year and it would cost about $140 to fix it!  Why would I invest in a camera that stopped working on my once?  I'm writing a letter of complaint to the company, so we'll see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I never have to worry about what happens to this camera.  Splashes, underwater, drops, it can handle it all.  Great pictures and video quality.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoor foret to get wet dont take care of the camera...
Reviews.Author: Fabricio Recalde
Reviews.Content: Great pictures from any activity I took it to the beach and swimming pool... Fun pictures from the kids and wife! Enought for a trip and to take it with you at all times.... records also audio and video of course... SAme olympus quality

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Malgirl
Reviews.Content: Worst camera I have ever owned. Takes horrible pictures, usually turn out blurred. Takes a long time for the camera to get set up to take a picture.  Also, once the battery starts getting a little low the camera will no longer focus at all.  This thing belongs in the trash, don't waste your money.  The Olympus quality has definately taken a steep dive downward.

Reviews.Title: Slightly better than the previous model
Reviews.Author: MARIANA CIAMPONE
Reviews.Content: I owned the previous model and I really liked it, but unfortunately it was stolen. So I decided to go for this newer model then.I really like the fact that it's a sturdy camera and also waterproof. HD video is awesome. The pictures are not great, but they usually come out OK. The biggest issue for me though is the slowliness. Sometimes I miss some great shots because the camera takes to long to start and between shots. Another problem is that the camera freezes sometimes, and then I have to remove the battery and put it back again.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: T. J. Michaud "racyg"
Reviews.Content: got this for my hubby. We hike and camp a lot and he wanted something that he didn't have to worry about breaking. So far we have used it at the river and in the swimming pool and it's been great. Been dropped once or twice with no damage.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Anoop Shamim
Reviews.Content: This camera is soo durable , and takes amazing pics. I mainly bought it to use underwater and it is amazing !!! takes great underwater pics and HD vidoes... I love the moments i capture with these.  Love this camera...

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Ondine Feldman
Reviews.Content: I'm not very tech savvy. I needed a camera to take on caribbean vacations that was able to get wet. This does the job but I wouldn't keep it submerged for more than a minute or two, contrary to what the instructions say the camera can handle. Also, rinse with fresh water as soon as possible. It gets a little finiky if its not immediately rinsed and dried. It hasnt lost any pictures but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: painful inside, great outside
Reviews.Author: CyberFreak
Reviews.Content: what I dislike:I had a hard time taking picture indoors, I tried every day for a while, I swear I was so frustrated I cried!!, it's HORRIBLE at this!! I tried adjusting a lot of things, flash, mode, sun position, my position, etc!, I even used a tripod because I thought maybe it was me moving.. I gave up on this... I finally gave up on the camera and tried selling it, but no one would buy it (I didn't try hard though..)I also don't like the camera screen, it's too small and doesn't display the picture well, a few pictures seemed just "ok" in the camera, but really good once I saw them on my computer...what I like...I like the pictures it takes outdoors, (they aren't the greatest, but they're really good)what I love...The videos it takes are really good!, great quality!!, plus it really does work underwater.. I haven't taken an underwater video though.. I just tested it, I haven't checked the quality of the pictures or videos it takes underwater..I also love the material, it feels heavy and tough, plus I love the design and the colorIt's a shame about the indoor pictures...I finally decided to keep it, since I bought it mainly because I was planning to take my kid to the beach, he's 1 yr old and I love taking picture of every step of his growth :)So I decided I'd use this camera for vacations or whenever I take him to the pool, and the iphone I use indoors, since I bought it afterwards, and discovered it  does take great indoor picturesbut I am planning on selling this and saving up for a great quality underwater camera maybe next year..If you have the chance to buy another one, (I hear cannon is really good), do it!!

Reviews.Title: TOUGH just like the name
Reviews.Author: satx
Reviews.Content: This camera has been put through its paces from the lake and river to the coast. It is everything it says it is and then some... Tough tough tough

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: RAUL LETUIRIA
Reviews.Content: justamente lo que esperaba, el articulo llego tal cual lo describían en la publicación, lo recomiendo 100%, es una empresa responsable

Reviews.Title: slow
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: I didin't like this camera. It's slow, I don't recomend for mya friends. I recomend to buy other models or brands

Reviews.Title: not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: Lorena
Reviews.Content: The previous model was much more easy to handle, the pictures were better and the speed too.Not sure to buy again this brand

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jessica lynne griffith
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera before our vacation to Mexico last summer. I read many reviews and some commented on the software being quirky. We have not encountered any of the problems that i read about. It's very durable and worked great while snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, not always waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a couple years ago and the first time I used it in the pool it worked for a couple minutes and then quit.  The screen showed an error message saying "no connection."  I opened the battery door and saw that is was completely full of water.  I would have returned it immediately had I not been on vacation.  I took the battery and sd card out and let it dry overnight.  It worked perfectly once dry so I decided to give it another shot.The rest of my vacation (two weeks) it worked perfectly in the pool and in the ocean (wading from beach only, no diving.)  Since then I have had the leakage issue a couple of times, even though I always make sure the seal on the battery door is clean and that the door is closed correctly.  The good thing is that it always works perfectly when dried out.  Overall it's a good camera with some minor irritations. I would buy Olympus products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Camera was great for my cruise vacation
Reviews.Author: C. Forsythe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because we were going on vacation and I wanted something that could be used underwater at up to 20 or 30 feet, since we had a SNUBA diving trip planned.  At first, I thought I was going to be like other reviewers who received a defective product.  My camera would turn on, show the Olympus logo and then turn back off.  I called Olympus customer service, and they said that I would need to send it back for repair.  I was very disappointed because I was planning to take it on vacation a few days after I received it.  I took the camera and banged it into my palm a couple times, and then tried turning it on again.  To my surprise, it turned right on and has been working ever since!  (I still took another camera with me on vacation just in case!)  I used it for outdoor and underwater photos and videos and it worked great.  I didn't use it much indoors because other reviewers said the quality was not that good.  So far, I am pleased with this camera, and hope it continues to work well, so my kids can take underwater pictures in the pool this summer.

Reviews.Title: it does what it says
Reviews.Author: BambiWatson
Reviews.Content: It really is shock proof, waterproof & cold proof.  I've had one for over 5 years & have used it on every vacation.  I purchased this one to send with my hubby to Afghanistan.  It worked great!!  There is a lot of sand over there & he wanted a durable camera that could take the sand.  He washes this one from time & it's been great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent equipment!
Reviews.Author: Nelxandro Sanchez Marquez
Reviews.Content: It's a usefull cam for fun and entertainment. Kids love this stuff and they enjoy take pictures and outside videos!

Reviews.Title: Not tough
Reviews.Author: Reginald H. Henderson
Reviews.Content: There's an awkward metal lens cover that pops up and down, uses battery, and stops working after a few months.  I dropped the camera and the lens broke, so... it's not tough enough, not even much tougher than a regular camera.  I wish I had saved the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Olympus use to be great cameras... not any longer
Reviews.Author: steve and janet baglien
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 Olympus cameras in 2012 - my point in shoot was the 5th in a series of cameras that I dropped or left in my pocket and cracked the screen, etc.  I purchased an upper end SLR-like Olympus for higher quality shots - 3 months from the date of purchase, the shutter button quit working - it still takes fine video, but that's not the point of the camera.  I purchased this camera because it's "Tough" - I should be able to drop it or get it wet and it's going to keep working right?  4 months later, it's dead.  I swapped batteries - nothing, made sure they're charged by putting them in my other camera - full charge - nothing.  Tried connecting it to my computer - dead.  I'll never purchase another Olympus camera.

Reviews.Author: Eduardo Meza
Reviews.Content: producto de gran calidad y muy economico, lo que buscaba me gusto mucho llego e perfecto estado, seguire comprando excelente

Reviews.Title: poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: The image quality is considerably lower than other point and shoots within the same price rangeThe auto mode does not work at all in low light conditions, you need to manually configure it to get a shot, it also uses a preflash for autofocusing that is annoyinh and makes me close my eyes before the actual photo is takenthe only good thing is the underwater feature

Reviews.Title: its great when it works, but getting to work isn't a reality
Reviews.Author: ndcColorado
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the "tough" and underwater features for my first cruise. As soon as I got it, I installed everything the way I was supposed to.  I tried some test shots and used it around the house and at different events (a parade, a school concert) and was happy with the quality of the pictures and was blown away at the software and its ability to tag faces and it seemed very accurate.  Then, the problems began.  IT wouldn't turn on. Or once it did, it would show a dark screen and the shutter would close. I would remove the battery and memory card, then replace them and turn it on.  It would work for a few shots, then freeze up again.  This happened over and over again.  I missed a lot of great sights on the tours because I was fiddling with my camera.  I should have just soaked it all in and kept my mental images instead of hoping for photographs.  I let my daughter use my "old" samsung point and soot camera.  She got great pictures.  I have since taken it back from her and use it as my primary camera.  I tried (even during the trip) re-initializing the camera via the software.  I did a full factory reset.  It worked for a while then started with the freezing up again.  Now, when I turn it on, it will show what I am pointing at in the LCD screen, but when I push the shutter button, the screen turns black or it will just completely turn off.  I am very disappointed with this camera.  I will go with a samsung next time.  They have great cameras for lower prices, and I don't think I will need the underwater capabilities anymore. It would be nice if it were water proof just because you never know when it will rain or get dropped, but its not worth the hassle of not having it work wet or dry. THe problems began before I even TRIED it in the water.  The shots I did get under water were great, and were able to capture the fish in vivid detail that we could hardly see through our goggles!  Its too bad that it wouldn't function because agian the picture quality was superior to what I expected, but it certainly was not "tough".  I didn't even drop it.

Reviews.Title: Lacks External Charger
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This camera follows in the Tough Line but lacks an external charger. USB charging only which leaves the battery door and seals open while charging. Big risk to it's toughness.E-Force City sells an external charger and battery for under $12. One would have thought Olympus could have done this.http://www.amazon.com/eForCity-Battery-Charger-Compatible-8010/dp/B0062F3EZU/ref=sr_1_10?ie=UTF8&qid;=1359268045&sr;=8-10&keywords;=olympus+8010+chargerOr the charger alonehttp://www.amazon.com/eForCity-CHARGER-Compatible-OLYMPUS-STYLUS/dp/B0043PHOWA/ref=sr_1_6?ie=UTF8&qid;=1359268130&sr;=8-6&keywords;=olympus+8010+charger

Reviews.Title: Mr James Kreckman
Reviews.Author: James Kreckman
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to our son for Christmas. But the receipt of package was timely and he enjoyed having a good quality camera

Reviews.Title: Buen producto
Reviews.Author: Manuel Gomez
Reviews.Content: No es tan automático la forma de tomar fotos. Esperaba una mejor calidad con menos acciones. Soporta bien el agua

Reviews.Title: in love
Reviews.Author: Janel
Reviews.Content: I am totally in love with this camera I had an older version of this camera and it got stolen so I finally bought a new one

Reviews.Title: Product rating of camera
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: I own this camera and am very happy with it so purchased two, one of each of my children for Christmas

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: javier hernandez
Reviews.Content: good product excellent service I hope to continue to improve in order to grow in esat paguina is better than

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Alexis Morfa
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 was the best camera in the market about a year ago. I had to return two cameras already. First one was for water intrusion, the second was for bad SD reader. Not thrilled and will not recommend to anyone. Wish Hero cameras had come out before .

Reviews.Title: 3rd time's a charm
Reviews.Author: Meg from BG
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd one of these cameras that my son has had.  He has ruined them simply by using them to death.  The first one he had out with his job on a 1000' ship and he simply beat it to a pulp by using it so much.  The 2nd one he opened under water in Belize...duh.  He still asked for this same camera for Christmas...must be a good one!!

Reviews.Title: Works for what I needed it for!
Reviews.Author: The Mrs.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go on a cruise.  One of the excursions was a water excursion, so I didn't want to take my regular camera.  It worked great for what I needed it for!  There are tons of picture options for indoor, outdoor, nighttime, candle light, food, etc. etc. etc.  The only thing I would say is that sometimes the pictures were blurry, but it wasn't worth taking a star away.

Reviews.Title: Good waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Rich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased this to take on our honeymoon cruise. We took underwater pictures snorkeling, swimming with dolphins and parasailing and didn't have to worry about getting it wet. It took great pictures, even under water! I'm very glad we had it for the cruise but now we don't have much use for it. After taking a picture, the camera takes about 10 seconds to clear the picture and be ready to take another one. It also takes about 10 seconds to boot up when you first turn it on. Its verrrry slow... But it was nice for water activities.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Sabrina O. "Bina"
Reviews.Content: That is okay about the product and it arrived on time.I do not have anything more to say about it yet.

Reviews.Title: A real waste of money
Reviews.Author: Nando "Pazzo Nando"
Reviews.Content: I don't have the patience or the respect for this product to write a long-winded review, so here's the short version: it takes terrible, blurry, pixelated photos.  I've taken better photos on a GoPhone.  Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Beware before purchasing
Reviews.Author: AlaskaJ
Reviews.Content: Had this item for 2 months and it is broken and will not charge. The camera does take great outdoor photos, but indoor photos require some practice. Hopefully we can return the camera since we've only had it 2 months.

Reviews.Title: Scam company
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: This is the worst company i have dealt with. I purchased this camera and used it once for 4 days last year on vacation in august. I went to charge it in august of this year and went to use it on September 3rd for vacation No power. I called for RA they said yes we will cover it. Upon arrival the camera of course isn't going to be covered and they are wanting the cost of the repair. No physical damage done by me just cheap quality that they wont back up.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever owned
Reviews.Author: DLT2010
Reviews.Content: I go ATV MUD Riding alot. I needed a camera that would hold up to water,mud,dirt etc. I have now owned this camera for over a year. I just purchased another one for my son. I have put this camera thru all the test even dropped on concrete. It got a little dent but still held up. At first the battery was not lasting very long. Then I found the battery saving setting in the menu. I thought about buying the newer model but y should I when this one works great. Just keep lens clean and all pictures will be good. In dusty enviroments the camera will pick up those small particles flying in the air and show spots on pic. Not cameras fault. This is the first time I ever have given a review, but felt this is such a great product thought I would share.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Alex Perez
Reviews.Content: Product was as described and  advertise arrive on time or within the promise arrival time , totally satisfied  with my purchase , Price was good

Reviews.Title: waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Danny Fuller
Reviews.Content: hard to use compaired to others that I have.  Does work well when used in wet weather.  Have not down loaded pictures from vacation yet.

Reviews.Title: Good water proof cam
Reviews.Author: Nog
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent waterproof camera.  I used it in the ocean when I went snorkeling and the pictures came out pretty good.  It's just a little bigger compared to a point and shoot camera, but overall it is an excellent waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome sports/outdoors camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Cervantes
Reviews.Content: Not only did I buy this awesome outdoor camera for myself, but I recommend it to 3 other friends of mine and they bought it and are enjoying it as well! It is an amazing camera no matter where you are and takes wonderful underwater pictures. I compare the picture quality to my Sony Cybershot and it's just as good if not better. Obviously I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: not so tough or great service
Reviews.Author: lechien
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about 20 months ago and have taken it pretty much throughout Alaska, and on a few extended trips.  I always keep it in a hard case that is water proof and provides a significant amount of protection for the camera.  Even so the camera has been acting up the last 6 months.  I contacted Olympus and they said for $130 plus shipping they would look at for me but did not say anything about a guarantee that they could fix it.  So for the same price I can buy a new one, poor service from Oly at best.Even when the camera was working it was okay.  The panorama feature worked seldom and I tried all the various modes, auto, computer, and by hand and none of them really matched up.  The camera is really slow to boot up and to take a shot.  I tried faster disk and new batteries, not much difference.  I was really hoping this would be my end all camera as I spend a lot of time outside summer and winter and was hoping to share that with friends and family.  Now the search goes on for a reliable camera and camera company that won't just forget about you once you purchase their product.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: swhite
Reviews.Content: I purchased this while backpacking and really liked the price. The menu isnt perfect but good enough. Inexplicably it broke and Olympus couldn't have done less to help me.

Reviews.Title: Slowest camera ever
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I normally never write reviews, but this camera has annoyed me this much, that I want to prevent others from experiencing the same.We bought the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010, because friends had the Stylus Tough 6020 which we really liked.We figured, we would buy the newer model that just came out at the time, because it could only be better, right?....However, the Tough 8010 has performed horribly since day one.We bought it right before a big trip to Iceland in February 2010.This was a big MISTAKE, as the camera FREEZES in cold weather (22F).Maybe that was pushing it's limits, but it even freezes when we go snowboarding in California (32F)....The worst complaint though is that this camera is too SLOW!!!Way too SLOW to turn on, too SLOW to record. Don't even think of capturing moving objects. Not even in the sports mode!The only way to maybe get one sharp image of a moving object is to have it on multiple image mode and hope that one of a series of 10 or so is good....And forget about shooting night pictures with this sluggish camera.I don't even want to think back to al those cool animals and events I missed on this camera!Another complaint is that the lens cover sometimes gets stuck in the casing.We complained right after we got back from our first trip.Unfortunately, because it was beyond the 30 day warranty, Olympus did not want to offer any replacement or solution.They blamed it on a too big memory card (8 Gigabytes) and us using the wrong settings.However, we already tried smaller memory cards (Mbs instead of Gigs) and restored factory settings.No improvements, and therefore really UNSATISFIED costumers, who really tried everything to make this camera work, and now will NEVER buy a personal Olympus product again!Tip: if you ever buy a camera online right before your trip, make sure you know what you're getting. Preferably test one in a store or know from friends how it works and get exactly that same model!Good luck with your waterproof camera search!

Reviews.Title: Barely Functions
Reviews.Author: Rev.
Reviews.Content: Very heavy and very slow.  When it does take a picture the white balance is off and images are often blurry - even the shutter is too slow.  Barely functions as a basic camera.  Panasonic Lumix seems far superior for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Dollar
Reviews.Author: underwater cam
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth every penny.  I took it with me on a beach vacation and because it was a water proof camera i was able to get pictures i never thought i can get.  The battery life is excellent, the video and picture quality is outstanding and i could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not Tough Enough
Reviews.Author: RLB
Reviews.Content: Initially the camera worked well. The shutter action was a little slow, but tolerable, given the camera was waterproof and shockproof.After a few months of use, the camera started shutting down as soon as it started up. Sometimes I can take a couple of pictures and sometimes I can't take any pictures. Battery is fully charged.Overall, the camera would have received an acceptable review, if it had continued to work correctly.

Reviews.Title: Good for extreme surroundings
Reviews.Author: Hanzo
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures is often blurry in normal situation. The panoramic function is outdated --> manual. For extreme situations (cold, underwater) it's an excelent device!

Reviews.Title: review of olympus camera
Reviews.Author: atila kovac
Reviews.Content: Camera is awesome, everything is perfect, from pictures to video . the only problem that I have is the battery, that will not last even for one day. so if you want to buy this camera you might think of the second battery right away.

Reviews.Title: Not my first choise but so glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: Z Espinal, Mass
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 because I was going on vacation and new I was going to be using it at the beach. I haven't dropped it yet but all the pictures we took came out amazing including the ones under water and the videos of the coral reef while snorkeling were beautiful will definitely recommend, the price was also very good.

Reviews.Title: cobkai
Reviews.Author: cobkai
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over two years. It's survived snowboarding, the beach, and scuba in Cozumel! It has a fantastic flash that creates luminous skin! Highly recommend for adventure seekers! *If you have a problem with it not functioning on, it might be a sand issue. In this case, emerging the whole camera under a facet will do. - Brilliant camera!

Reviews.Title: Good, tough camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Shea
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for about 6 months and still like it.  I don't love it, but I like it, and it's held up to being dropped, chewed by my dogs, and I've used it several times under water.  Add to the fact you can buy a reasonably priced dive case for it, and I have to say I'm more than pleased.  I still wish Cannon could turn out a camera this tough and versatile.

Reviews.Title: Lost camara will buy again
Reviews.Author: Dr. Carlos A. Malaga
Reviews.Content: Have used the camera every weekend for over a year.  Snorkeling, body surfing, toddler playing in sand e tc.  Takes great pictures and videos both above and under water.  Great color and contrast.  Very slow between photos.  Overall a great camera.  Lost when large wave broke neck strap.  Will buy again .

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for another Camera I wasn't expecting the Movie to be in HD. My laptop computer doesn't recognize the format. Nowhere in the advertizements does it mention HD anywhere. If it had, I would have never purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy Happy
Reviews.Author: Dimensional Daisy
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera! Took it under water and took some funny photos, no leaks, so far so good. I use it instead of my other one. Beach trip with salt water next. Looking forward to it. Thank you Olympus!

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I use this for work which is commercial diving and we use this camera for still and video. It is easy to use. It takes great underwater pics deeper with the Ikalite housing. A++++ product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Cristian Reader Santos Mejia
Reviews.Content: Excellent Camera for Sport and aventure.  I'll use in Mountainbike and in my job too. Tha most important is the Camera is waterproof and shockproof with the excellent image.

Reviews.Title: Great water camera
Reviews.Author: momoftwo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced submersible camera to take on our cruise.  Had this Olympus for 8 days in the Carribean.  Underwater photos of snorkeling, the kids playing in the pool, everything.  Worked like a charm.  Simple to use, and the instructions say to rinse it off in clean water when you're done (I never would've thought about that).  Definitely worth the $142 bucks.

Reviews.Title: thanks
Reviews.Author: MEL
Reviews.Content: I took the camera on a family vacation,  and loved it. It takes great pics,even better that we could take it in the ocean!

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: I thought that this product is great for the price. I bought this camera last year before going to Hawaii on my honeymoon. We used the camera snorkeling and for out of water pictures. The battery life last a long time and the quality of the pictures was just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Loved the underwater feature but the other features are little complicated
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: The water feature is a lot of fun to use but the other features and modes are not as user friendly to manuever.  I was really hoping for a point and click and its just not that easy.  I need to spend a little more time reading the manual.

Reviews.Title: Talk about a Muddy Buddy!
Reviews.Author: ijustbuy
Reviews.Content: I do mud runs all the time and was looking for a camera to take with me.  THIS THING IS INCREDIBLE!!  To wash it, you submerge it in water for 10 minutes!! There's only one thing I want to know: WHERE HAS THIS CAMERA BEEN MY WHOLE LIFE?!?!  I'd give it more than 5 stars if I could!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BijouRoi
Reviews.Content: The pictures this camera takes are more sharp & in better detail than I expected for a camera without an SLR lens! I'm pleased!

Reviews.Title: not as good as 1030
Reviews.Author: clayton
Reviews.Content: This camera has shutter lag depending on the quality of light the photos sometimes seem grainy.  I had the stylus 1030 before this camera and it had no lag and took better pics even though it had 4 less megapixels?

Reviews.Title: My 3rd Olympus - All great!
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Conrad "Traveller"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus camera. A weather proof Stylus 410, it still works well. Then an upgrade to a waterproof to 10' Stylus Tough 6000, a super camera that someone stole from me. This lastest one is the Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Blue). It has maintained the quality of the previous ones with added features of 14MP, waterproof to 30' and  increased internal memory. The great thing also that it was about the same price as the original camera I had. Highly recommended.Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Jax
Reviews.Content: Very easy to operate.  Excellent pictures under water and outside.  A little difficult to get settings right for indoor pictures and I just could not get the fireworks setting to work properly.  That, however was not the reason for the purchase so we are very happy with it.  It was great for snorkling and swimming.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 8010!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This is the best foto camera for this proce. My children are very happy when watching foto take in swimming pool. It's very easy to use and simple funkction.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera! Do NOT buy!
Reviews.Author: Larry D. Purviance
Reviews.Content: This camera takes horribly grainy, terribly out of focus photos. About 50 percent are ruined completely. The other 50 percent are about as good as my Droid Razr takes. I misspoke: The Razr takes BETTER video. When videotaping, the camera "hunts" in and out focus.There may be the slightest-inkling of hope: I just now downloaded the Olympus firmware update (1.1)and I am going to give this thing one more chance. The Olympus site was wonderful and the downloaded new software went onto the camera without a hitch. It already seems to turn on faster and less lag in the shutter button. But if the photos next weekend are as bad as ever, this thing is going onto Craigslist for a quick sell.UPDATE: I properly downloaded the firmware from Olympus's website, full of hope that it would fix the focusing problem and the horribly grainy photo problem.It didn't. The camera is for sale on Craigslist at 1/3 the price of what I paid for it. Took it out Kayaking this last weekend and 25 percent of the photos were completely out of focus. Lest someone claims that it was user error, we had two older olympus waterproof cameras using them under the same conditions and neither one turned out a single out of focus shot. That's it: These things ruin on average 25 percent of all shots.....there will be a string of between 5 and 20 shots in a row, all out of focus. Out of 200 shots taken, 40 were in strings of out of focus shots. One right after another.I'm done.

Reviews.Title: Camera Olympus
Reviews.Author: Erwing E Izquierdo M
Reviews.Content: Very excelent the product, expectative allow!!thanksOlympus Stylus Tough 8010 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great Design, bad reaction time.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: A great camera if you an active person or just clumsy. This camera is almost indestructible, I've banged it up so many times taken it to the beach and water parks. However, I do find that it doesn't take the pictures quick enough or at a quality I would like as a photographer, but it was my best option seeing I constantly tend to destroy my point-and-shoots going the places I go and keeping it in my handbag. It is also a bit heavy but worth having as an active person.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: Beware of this camera!! I had this camera for a year and it will no longer function. I never took it in water and to be honest barely used it. this camera stopped working right after the warranty expired (go figure). even when I did use this camera and it did "work" the pictures were poor and mostly out of focus and/or too bright/too dark. not to mention that when you want to take a picture it takes way too long to turn on and take the picture. I contacted olympus and they wanted to charge me $160. to buy a refurbished one..... I told them to E-waste it.... his camera was a significant waste of money and would not suggest it to anyone. if you really want a nice water proof camera that takes good pictures.. go with the canon Powershot D-10, heres the link:  Canon PowerShot D10 12.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Good camera, difficult menus
Reviews.Author: R. Hall "Just a photography buff"
Reviews.Content: If you want a "tough" camera, this certainly should be checked out carefully.  This is our second one because the first one 4 years old, died without good cause.  So don't expect these cameras to be truly "tough."  They are dust and water resistant, but not really rugged and certainly not underwater cameras.  They are great for the beach, skiing, hiking, etc. where a regular camera would have to be treated with great care.  The menu is not as intuitive as it could be because it has too many features we will never use.  There was no external battery charger included.  To charge the battery you open the compartment, plug in the charger cord, and leave it for a couple hours, exposing the inside of the camera to the elements.  But, the camera serves its purpose as a general use point-and-shoot digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: i got this camera on Bestbuy, it works great so far, i tested on water and everything looks fine no problem at all, i love the quality pictures, its a worthy item for the price

Reviews.Title: What does "P" mode really mean?
Reviews.Author: CW Fan
Reviews.Content: Pretty new camera.  The program mode ("P") on the camera seems to really mean "P"urposely don't focus properly--virtually no picture comes out in-focus.  I've tried all the focus modes and none of them seems to make any difference.  We've taken to shooting in "iAUTO" just so they're in-focus.  Otherwise, it works well.  Likes: the underwater capability.  Not ready to recommend this product, just because of the focus issues.  Contacted Olympus Tech Support, but not really expecting a resolution as there aren't any software updates available for it.

Reviews.Title: It's good for a waterproof, rugged camera.
Reviews.Author: James F.
Reviews.Content: It does what it's advertised to do. It's doesn't take amazing pictures unless you really play around with the settings. If you let the battery get too low it will start to misbehave and leave your pictures out of focus. But for the most part, it is super reliable and does a great job. Haven't had any waterproof issues. You just need to be sure to take care of it like the instructions say.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Camera
Reviews.Author: Machinehead
Reviews.Content: This camera has proven itself time and time again. When I first got it I gave it to my kids who put it through the ringer and it still works good. I would suggest to anybody, who needs a durable camera with good picture quality, to buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible picture quality, not a reliable camera
Reviews.Author: Erin S McCarty
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just over a year ago.  The photo quality was HORRIBLE.  Even with changing the shutter speed the quality didn't improve.To add insult to injury, I took this camera on a once in a lifetime 21-day trip on the Grand Canyon and it broke on day two.  The seals blew out and I got almost ZERO photos.If you are a skier, then forget being able to take this in the cold...you will likely damage your camera if temperatures at perfect skiing conditions of 15 degrees.Olympus Customer Support is HORRIBLE.  Do NOT buy this camera.Go Cannon -- the photo quality is higher, the camera is more reliable.  The size & weight are worse, but that is a small price to pay to be able to capture better memories.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronko
Reviews.Content: My older camera a Canon - expensive camera was damaged by water when I was in the Galapagos - I take a lot of pictures - and a friend had one of these and I was very impressed by the camera and the pictures -- So far I am still learning the features -- and hope this solves my problem with mositure(traveling in Central and South America) as well as in the US.

Reviews.Title: awesome, super durable camera
Reviews.Author: nfleet01
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I thought it would be. It looks good, it's durable, and it takes great quality images. Still trying to figure all of the settings out, but I am enjoying it a lot. Best point and shoot camera out there outside of the Olympus TG810.

Reviews.Title: Love my Stylus Tough!
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I love my new olympus stylus tough.  Its exactly what I needed in a camera.  I needed a camera that would hold up to taking photos outdoors in all kinds of circumstances.  I like to take it with me when I'm riding my 4wheeler.  With this camera, I don't have to worry if it gets a little wet or if it gets shaken around a little.  It's great for indoor photos too!  It has all kinds of selections to choose from.  It's a great camera!

Reviews.Title: good camera for a good price
Reviews.Author: dmitry
Reviews.Content: Don't expect it to be SLR or something, but it is tough and it does work.Great camera for skiing, going to beach etc. I like it and its always in my back pack (little bit heavy, as you'd expect).Two problems i see: a) start-up time - 5 seconds or so, so use it in power-save mode and keep it on when appropriate; b) long pause between pictures unless you are taking hi-speed (2 secs or so), so you can't go clatz-clatz-clarz as you'd do with SLR. Well, there's also flash light that would fire even when there's enough light sometimes + you make sure you keep your index out of view, so there's a special grip you develop over time, - but these are not really a problems. Other than that, there's nothing to say.Love "punch" control - you can just bump it on the either side to go through menu / photos etc. Also, you don't have to be careful with it, obviously.Overall - 5 stars for being great for a price.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy this Product!...Especially if you're a Deploying Soldier.
Reviews.Author: Christopher P. Villalta
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line Up Front: I've continuously required service for Tough Camera products due to their lack of reliability and lack of guaranteed durability.Note: Poor customer service rating attributed to Olympus service, not Amazon.com.First Failure: I purchased the Tough 6020. Shortly afterwards, and with little reason, the front panel was dented causing the camera to be inoperable.Second Failure: I replaced the old camera for the new Tough 8010.  The SDHC slot was damaged because a tiny pin was bent backwards, causing the camera to be inoperable.  (No...I didn't try to put in the card backwards)Third Failure: The repaired Tough 8010 lens cover was jammed open and couldn't close, causing the camera to be inoperable.Description of Failures:I originally purchased the Tough 6020 camera to be used on my 2010 Iraq deployment.  I had it protected in a case and stowed in a pouch in my vest.  The product was found a few hours later to have a dent on the front panel.  Despite the 200 lbs. load the camera was claimed to withstand; it would not work.  I sent it to Olympus, as the camera was covered under a year warranty.  The product was repaired, but could not be mailed back to me because Olympus is not able to mail to addresses overseas.  I had the camera shipped home and decided to give it to my parents.  In the mean time, I purchased a newer, Tough 8010 and had it mailed to me in Iraq via Amazon.After I received my new Tough 8010, I inserted the SDHC memory card correctly.  I took pictures, but couldn't save them on my memory card. I took out the card and reinserted it.  It still wouldn't work.  After inspecting the SDHC memory card slot, I discovered a tiny pin to be bent backwards.  The camera was covered under factory warrantee, so it was sent to Olympus for repairs.  After the camera was repaired and sent to my home, my parents sent the camera back to me.  This process took months to complete; so I didn't get many pictures taken during my deployment in Iraq. Awesome...I know...After returning home from my deployment in 2011, I was using the camera in a park.  The camera mysteriously stopped working because the lens cover was stuck open.  I sent the camera back to Olympus because it was still covered under factory warrantee.  I told Olympus I want my money back and was told by a customer service representative that this option was not available.  I was told I had to keep this camera after it's repaired, and to take up any issues regarding returns with the original seller.  This issue is still ongoing.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: picturemonster
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to buy and use this camera before a surf trip to Costa Rica. Although I did ignore some bad reviews, I wont do that again.I really liked the fact that I would be able to go out and surf with my friends and take turns snapping pictures of each other surfing.  However, this would never work out.The menus seemed great and I liked the fact that the information was readily available for each setting.  Really Cool!  That's the good stuff.When I started taking pictures was when I really got disappointed.  In the water regardless of setting, auto focus/spot/faces or fast shutter speed or auto, shadow adjust on/off or auto etc. etc. the pictures were out of focus and blurry.  Of hundreds of pictures I took not one pic or video was in focus.  I was getting so mad in the line up because it continued to focus on what I didn't want it to capture, never on the center of the screen in spot focus and auto focus always picked some random piece of water to focus on.  The videos were constantly going in and out of focus...like every 2 seconds, so It was painful to watch.  And this was also while I was filming standing on the beach.  There was just too much activity for the camera to stay focused on what I wanted it too.  Again, I tried every setting.On top of this the pictures will randomly show up very dark, as in barely bright enough to see anything, and this was on a bright day on the beach.  It looked like night time with no flash honestly.  This, again, would happen with all different setting configurations, I tried everything.  Further, the flash always goes off making the bright room even darker, even on the odd chance the picture didn't turn out in it's typical "night mode"(what I have come to call the dark pictures).  And finally, when the picture does stay bright, and I have manually turned the flash off...again...the picture is blurry.  There is a little red icon of a shaking camera that pops up in the upper left corner.  This happens 90% of the time, even when its resting on a solid surface...  and with EVERY setting.I have never wanted to throw something against a wall so badly in my life.I have tried to figure it out, stupidly, over several more vacations (guess who always had the worst pictures), thinking that it was something I was doing wrong, but I have finally given up. I really wanted it to work out. Maybe the thing is broken.  I hear Olympus customer service is terrible so I am not expecting much.  I feel like I've been robbed and the memories from my vacations have been stolen.If what you are looking for is an expensive,rugged camera that takes grainy, blurry and dark pictures then please buy mine.NEVER, under any circumstances, buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: cutsey
Reviews.Content: The camera is only 5 months old and already has a black shady looking mark on the screen. It just appeared there, and wasn't there before and there was no damage to the camera.  This is an expensive camera.  This shouldn't have happened.

Reviews.Title: for my wife
Reviews.Author: nanmka
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife.  She loves the beach.  She doesn't use half the features available.  It's strong, durable, and water resistant.  I have to remind her to clean the lens of salt.  She has had no problems with sand or water.  She can take very good pictures where I wouldn't dare bring my $2000 camera.

Reviews.Title: Industrial Tech.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This Camera is great I work in harsh dusty, dirty conditions and this camrea does a great job. I have also used it in the ocean in Aruba on vacation while snorkeling it did great there as well. All I have to say BUY IT you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Blast from the past...
Reviews.Author: Sawsawn
Reviews.Content: The only pros for this camera are the durability and underwater abilities.  Otherwise it's like using a 5 year old camera which is painfully slow to use and takes blurry pics. Returning it.

Reviews.Title: Aprox. 1 year water proof
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Rodriguez "Michael D. R."
Reviews.Content: Is the 3erd Olympus water proof i have had, and all of it died after a year, my first one i didn't check the seals ever but after that i read the manual. After putting it under the water two times less than 2 feet, checked the seals were clean, my Tough 8000 stopped working, it had water inside. I'm very disappointed. I put this review at this model because they are the Tough family. My advice is that you can buy it and it is really tough for all other not water proof camera, and I'll buy another for sure, but going under water is like Russian roulette. I'm a really active mountain biker and i can't have not water proof cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera I had the benefit of already having had used the very similar 6010. I love this camera. the picture quality is great, it has all sorts of cool features, including a very good sport mode and a mode where it takes picture continuously as long as you hold the button. The videos are really good quality and it takes good pictures underwater too... I really recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: such a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: None "None"
Reviews.Content: I had an older model of the olympus waterproof/dropproof camera, an 8 megapixel ebast of a thing that has been through hell and survived. So I decided to upgrade in anticipation of a trip to Puerto Rico, and uncertainty as to whether the gaskets on my 4 year old camera would hold, particularily when diving. On the first day I had it, the battery ran out extremely quickly, and the pictures were shakey and lacking 'spark'. This camera broke within 30 minutes of its second use. I was fooling around with it in the sea on day 2, and the window cover became stuck halfway between open and closed. I managed to fix it that night in the hotel room by jamming a key into the space a forcing it closed. The problem repeated itself daily for the rest of the trip. Had it not gotten lost with my luggage, I would have returned it when I got home.I assume the other olympus models (the ones that are only waterproof to 10 feet instead of 30, are still as awesome as my old one was. I reccomend you buy one of those. I'm going back to using my old 8 mp.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but it leaked.
Reviews.Author: Shaun Gianetti "TriniG"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Olympus waterproof camera. I really like the new toughness in this solid camera. For the most part it takes great pictures. Sometimes even better than my DSLR. I recently took it on a Ski trip and it handled the cold weather great, skiing and snow mobiling. I shot in Snow & Beach mode most of the time. I wish the software would remember the last user mode though, because it always defaulted to another mode. So every time I switched on, I had to navigate to Snow mode. Bummer. My older 1030SW seemed to have a better user interface. Don't even bother with the AUtomatic Panorama mode. It sucked terribly. You are better off stitching your own panorama yourself.Underwater: A mode I hold precious and dear as I Scuba and Snorkel a lot. I thought the extra latch locking mechanism would be fantastic. Well, when I was in Australia this January snorkeling on a camping trip, after a few shots the damn thing leaked. And I wasn't deeper than 7 ft. How disappointing is that? The rest of the time was shot with my iPhone.Luckily, Olympus had an authorized repairer in Perth just 20 minutes from where I stayed. So with my Amazon receipt and Online registration receipt, they handled the repair in a day and a half. Very impressive.The HD video quality was more than acceptable for me. Looked good on a 1080p 40" flat screen TV. I mostly share video online with friends, so I don't need much more than that.WOUld I buy again? Maybe, If I could be assured of the Waterproof-ness. But I think most of the cameras in this category have had some issues. Maybe this was just my bad luck this time.

Reviews.Title: Very let down
Reviews.Author: Boo-yaka-shaw
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a great purchase, but after exactly one week of moderate use, the camera completely stopped working. It's beyond return time and now I'm stuck with this hunk of junk that won't even turn on. I suggest you look for a different camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Golfmom
Reviews.Content: My son is using this camera overseas while on military duty.  It takes awesome pictures, easy to use, and tough, not to mention waterproof!

Reviews.Title: It did all that I asked.
Reviews.Author: Toby
Reviews.Content: The camera performed as I hoped.  Took great shots on land and in the water when we were snorkeling.  Recommend that you buy extra batteries though, it goes through them in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality, Inconsistent Exposure, Overpriced
Reviews.Author: CNJ2000
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as replacement for my Olympus 770SW-- which by the way, performed very well.  The Stylus Tough 8010, however, produces inferior photos.  Even when using the flash indoors, the resulting photos tend to come out underexposed-- even after using the exposure compensation.  I took five photos on a tripod with the same composition with both fill flash on and with auto flash on.  In all instances the flash fired but the exposure for the photos varied.  There obivously is a pre-flash built in the camera and this may be causing the camera to misread/miscalculate exposure. Also, indoors under incandescent lighting, if you use auto White Balance any white has a blue tint.  If you use the incandescent setting for WB, EVERYTHING COMES OUT AN UNNATURAL BLUE.It seems that the trend for camera companies is to add impressive features, gimmicks, etc. aimed at the novice photographer rather than focusing on actual image quality.

Reviews.Title: olympus 8010
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: The camera is slow on resetting after taking a pitcher and doesn't stay on the last setting when power is turned off. Other than that  I'm very pleased with the camera

Reviews.Title: Give it a chance... (updated)
Reviews.Author: R Snow
Reviews.Content: When I first bought this I almost immediately returned it to the store.  I had many complaints that have already been posted here.  Slow speed, grainy photos.... I took this out on a three week trip to the brooks range and shot about 400 pictures with it and about 20 vids.  The more I shot with it the better my pictures got.  I will admit it does take some getting use to and knowing what setting to use in each photo.  The Auto setting work so so. And the Auto focus is not the fastest either.  But one thing to keep in mind is this is a ruggedized piece of equipment which means there is going to be extreme sacrifices at one end of the spectrum to gain on the other.  In the end I turned out to be happy with this camera.Follow up:  After a year I'm still happy with the quality of the camera but not the images.  This camera does very poorly in low light situations which is what we have most of the winter in Alaska.  I would have not purchased this knowing what I know now.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Well, I am not a professional, but this camera is awesome.  I love the video and picture features.  I haven't used it underwater yet, but can't wait to video my kids swimming.  It's so compact and is super easy to operate.  I am so excited about this camera.  I want to use it everyday.  The video is awesome.  I wasn't expecting this camera to zoom like my DSLR camera.  It does great for having so much in one little camera.  So far our pictures have been good too.  We actually feel comfortable letting our 3 and 5 year olds take pictures.  They both have taken great pictures of us.  What does that tell you about it being easy!!!  By the look and feel of the camera, you might not think it as durable as it is.  But I can't be happier with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Geat Camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the camera. Works great for it's design, takes punishment and is great in the water. Love the functions and camera abilities. Arrived quickly, works great. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: fun camera
Reviews.Author: L. D. Kiser
Reviews.Content: received it fast and had a few days to practice before vacation.  it was fun using the different features.  i am still playing with it.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy this Product!...Especially if you're a Deploying Soldier.
Reviews.Author: Christopher P. Villalta
Reviews.Content: Bottom Line Up Front: I've continuously required service for Tough Camera products due to their lack of reliability and lack of guaranteed durability.Note: Poor customer service rating attributed to Olympus service, not Amazon.com.First Failure: I purchased the Tough 6020. Shortly afterwards, and with little reason, the front panel was dented causing the camera to be inoperable.Second Failure: I replaced the old camera for the new Tough 8010.  The SDHC slot was damaged because a tiny pin was bent backwards, causing the camera to be inoperable.  (No...I didn't try to put in the card backwards)Third Failure: The repaired Tough 8010 lens cover was jammed open and couldn't close, causing the camera to be inoperable.Description of Failures:I originally purchased the Tough 6020 camera to be used on my 2010 Iraq deployment.  I had it protected in a case and stowed in a pouch in my vest.  The product was found a few hours later to have a dent on the front panel.  Despite the 200 lbs. load the camera was claimed to withstand; it would not work.  I sent it to Olympus, as the camera was covered under a year warranty.  The product was repaired, but could not be mailed back to me because Olympus is not able to mail to addresses overseas.  I had the camera shipped home and decided to give it to my parents.  In the mean time, I purchased a newer, Tough 8010 and had it mailed to me in Iraq via Amazon.After I received my new Tough 8010, I inserted the SDHC memory card correctly.  I took pictures, but couldn't save them on my memory card. I took out the card and reinserted it.  It still wouldn't work.  After inspecting the SDHC memory card slot, I discovered a tiny pin to be bent backwards.  The camera was covered under factory warrantee, so it was sent to Olympus for repairs.  After the camera was repaired and sent to my home, my parents sent the camera back to me.  This process took months to complete; so I didn't get many pictures taken during my deployment in Iraq. Awesome...I know...After returning home from my deployment in 2011, I was using the camera in a park.  The camera mysteriously stopped working because the lens cover was stuck open.  I sent the camera back to Olympus because it was still covered under factory warrantee.  I told Olympus I want my money back and was told by a customer service representative that this option was not available.  I was told I had to keep this camera after it's repaired, and to take up any issues regarding returns with the original seller.  This issue is still ongoing.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: MrDaveyGie
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in this camera. Using it's features is awkward. It doesn't work in cold weather, the battery goes dead when it is cold out. I dropped it from 4 feet and the little flap for cabling broke off so it is no longer weather proof. Picture quality is poor.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this camera
Reviews.Author: marty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were so in love with this camera and its easy and user friendly functions. We had this camera all in all for 4 months before it just died. Didn't submerge it in water nor drop it. Just stopped. We also had the Stylus 1030SW ancestor prior to this one that lasted a little longer, 7 months. But that one died after getting it slightly wet at the beach. After contacting Olympus for a replacement that was over $700 worth of cameras (we bought them both as they came out new on the market) they requested a ridiculous amount of red tape. The original receipt was lost unfortunately due to relocating and Best Buy was less than unkeen in any assistance. Funny how they can locate items and information when they need it and it suits them but when it does not, they can never find the necessary details. The Lumix seems as an excellent replacement choice.

Reviews.Title: Heavy and confusing
Reviews.Author: Harriet M. Malone
Reviews.Content: Olympus brands are wonderful but this camera has a few faults.  The first and worst is that it is very heavy.  In all fairness, the weight of this is due to its protective casing which allows it to be dropped and taken underwater..We found the lens to be rather slow.  Perhaps pratice will increase the ease of switching betwen modes...but it is made to be more than a point and shoot ,so unless you are a snorkler or are particularly clumsy , I would opt for a different Olympus model.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE CÁMARA DIGITAL
Reviews.Author: J. C. Nieto Herrera "El Recreo"
Reviews.Content: Esta es mi 3er cámara Olympus. Al inicio estaba indeciso de comprarla porque al ser muy nueva, no tenía muchas referencias previas de otros usuarios. Pero realmente estoy FELIZ con la compra realizada. Es una cámara que funciona muy bien. Videos de excelente calidad, al igual que las fotos en diferentes ambientes. Tengo dos hijos pequeños que les gusta tomar fotografías, necesitaba una cámara que fuera durable y resistente a golpes....para mi tranquilidad encontré una de las mejores en el mercado... adicional de poder usarla en los viajes a la playa y a las piscinas ... sin importar que se mojara... excelente !!! La recomiendo al 100%

Reviews.Title: So many issues
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Ray
Reviews.Content: I recently moved to Guam and needed a camera that I could take to the beach and other places without concern. I asked around and all of my friends had the Olympus Style Tough Serious and although none of the loved the camera they said it did the job so I went with it. The camera despite its claim of being "shock prof" has broken twice from drops, both of which were from waste high onto grass completely refuting the claim that it can be dropped from a certain high without problems. Although the company has repaired the camera both times causing it to have been in there hands more then mine sins I purchased the item I have had trouble with there repair process as well. They have sent it back to me missing parts or other problems causing more delays in the time I have had to use the camera. All of this being said not having the camera hasn't been that bad because I am so disappointed in the picture quality. The color is muted and even the pictures taken on dry land have a blurriness to them. I have found myself taking my Nikon camera to the beach at great risk just to still get quality pictures rather then settle for the Olympus ones. After talking with my friends who own the camera most of them agree with the problems with the picture quality and one of them has also had to send it in for repairs but his drop was a little more severe.

Reviews.Title: Initial reactions to stylus tough 8010... not good
Reviews.Author: None
Reviews.Content: Bought this puppy to replace a stylus tough 8000.lost in the drink while snorkeling in Balize.The lost camera was terrlfic met all needs and took great pictures underwater and above... just wanted to replace it.Have't yet used this camera, but getting it set up has been time consuming and inconvenient. Manuals and instructions are poor and sketcy. The operating manual is only provided on line and set up is lengthy and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Tough 8010 14MP Digital
Reviews.Author: Ektor
Reviews.Content: Most cameras have nice features about photography but few are designed to withstand shock, falls, weather effects such as water, dust, this camera meets these additional requirements that are a necessary, as far as photos and video refers is excellent with good prestige acquired long-Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Botched upgrade from Sylus 1030
Reviews.Author: John Whittenberger
Reviews.Content: Olympus stopped servicing the Stylus 1030 so I had to purchase a new camera.  I decided to get a Stylus Tough 8010.Olympus did away with the dial and rocker switches used to select the various functions.  You have to go into an onscreen menu.  Unfortunately this doesn't work for folks like me who need reading glasses since onscreen is much less legible.The on/off switch does not immediately open the shutter over the lens.  I've tried holding the button down for varying lengths of time but action seems pretty arbitrary.Software is also botched.  The old software, Olympus Master 2, had a rational method of storing files, grouping files, and editing files.  The new software, ib, does not.ib dumps files into directories by download date even though the download contains multiple shooting dates.ib forces full screen mode when viewing pictures or videos.  This is a huge drawback when you are trying to select photos for Facebook or other uses.  There is no way to turn this off.ib's edit mode has no way to delete a photo!  Delete does not appear anywhere.  You have to go to your OS.ib's Update Software claims not to have an internet connection and exits.  There is no way to tell ib that it has a connection and how to use it.ib's Location option also claims to have no internet connection.  There is no way to fix this either.I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: 8010 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: BQ 9000
Reviews.Content: This Camera is perfect. It's small easy to handle fits in your pocket so easy to work. This is great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera my second one
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I bought this after my canon d10 leaked two days into my trip in 2009. Camera worked great underwater no leaking, excellent pictures. I liked it so much I bought an underwater case pt 048 And external flash.  The camera I'm reviewing on amazon is the backup camera I bought I liked the first one so much. Just incase I do something stupid to break the first one.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: E-Mom
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money!  Bought this to correspond with the birth of our first baby...awful camera!  Takes forever to take a photo and the photos it does take come out horrible!  We will only be using this as our water camera!  But if I had known how crappy it was I would have bought a more expensive water camera  since I had to buy another camera to replace this one after only a few months!

Reviews.Title: Camera Leaks
Reviews.Author: Texan MD
Reviews.Content: I bought a Stylus Tough 8000 and it broke in about a month. I sent it into the customer care and they 'repaired' it and sent it back to me, it broke again, I sent it back and they returned it and it broke again, they then sent me a new Stylus 8010 and it broke as well. all water leaks that destroyed the inside as well as all of the data on it. I tried to send it in again but Olympus told me it was out of warranty. I have since bought a Nikon and it has been the best purchase I have ever made. Do not pick any of the Stylus Tough cameras as they are far from tough and not worth it at all. Save yourself the heart ache and go with any other brand. I will never buy another Olympus product again!

Reviews.Title: EDITED
Reviews.Author: HGM
